story:
Dustin’s Phoenix Bike Tour!

             Hey Friends and Family! I just wanted to start off by giving a big thank you for stopping by my Indiegogo page! I know that it is easy to get caught up in our lives, and I know that there are probably some of you that I have not spoken to in a while (we have to fix this error). I think it goes without saying that we often need to slow things down in order to appreciate our surroundings and each other, this is precisely why I am doing a bike tour from Denver Colorado to Phoenix Arizona. I also want to reiterate that if you are unable to, or choose not to back my trip that it is totally fine to check out what I am doing, and what adventures lie ahead. I hope too that my trip might inspire others to get out of their comfort zone and try new things. For the next few minutes I would like to do a quick overview of how I got into this adventure, and a brief outline of what I am doing, and where I am going. After that we will sum up what your donations will do for me, and lastly, what your donations will get you (I know that what I will be giving back is a bit meager, but I still hope that you enjoy it).

 

What the heck am I doing, and how did I get into this mess? Both good questions! I am going to be riding my bicycle from the small town of Castle Rock near Denver to Phoenix Arizona. Most of my ride will be cutting through the southern part of the Rocky Mountains where I will then cycle through the Northwest portion of the Navajo Nation in New Mexico. I decided on Phoenix for a couple of reasons, the main one being that my brother Devan just moved out there last year and I want to go see him and Shannon and my nieces. I have also not explored this region of the United States very much and what better way to see it than on the saddle of a bicycle!!

    But how did I decide to do this? Well last May I sold my vehicle and decided that I would commute to work full time and use my bicycle as my primary means of transportation. I ended the year with over 1200 miles commuted to work, not to mention cycling that I did on my free days. Needless to say I immediately fell in love with cycling and decided to try bike packing. Bikepacking is essentially backpacking but cycling instead of hiking (for the most part). I found this to be even more enjoyable than traditional backpacking because of the opportunities it opened to see more places and meet more people in a shorter amount of time. Immediately I began doing research on bike touring (mostly sticking to paved roads) and thus my trip to Phoenix spawned from that research!

 

How long is my trip going to take? What will I be doing along the way? Expecting that I will take a day or two off from biking during my tour then I should be arriving on my 14th or 15th day. This is dependent on my pace of course, and it may alter slightly, but two week would be my goal! My daily average should hopefully be about 60 or 65 miles per day, however, some days that I have steep hill climbs will be much lower.

Along the way I will mostly be camping with the exception of a few days where I will be staying with a host family and another day where I will be staying at a cheap hotsprings to get a much needed break from my hardest days of cycling. The rest will be free camping along the way that you can check out on the map back on my indiegogo page. This will no doubt be a tough trip mentally and physically, but I feel strong, and keeping you all in my thoughts will make me even stronger!

 

Where will my money be going? The donations that you give to me will be going to two different things. One will be the last few pieces of gear that I need for my trip, and the other will be assisting in my personal expenses while I am gone. Though I do have some vacation time saved up, I do not have nearly enough to cover the entire trip (I will be taking off a month from work). The amount I am asking for in addition to the vacation time that I have accrued should allow me to do my trip and give me a slight cushion in case anything bad happens along the way. If I do end up getting more money than what I am asking then those funds will go towards my next bike touring adventure, so if you would like to make a donation but I have already hit my goal, don’t think that it won’t go towards the same cause. Throughout the last year and a half I have obtained most of the gear I will need on my trip, but what I still need are mostly essential items. Though I would sincerely appreciate gifts of these items, due to the nature of my job I can get good discounts on all said gear. The list is as follows:

Ortlieb sport-packer plus (Main set of front panniers, I have already purchased the rear panniers)

Revelate Designs Tangle bike frame bag (Bag for putting bike tools, snacks, and extra storage space)

Garmin Explorer 820 (I have not 100% decided on this, and may change devices

MSR Pocket Rocket (Again, I may do a different burner depending on conditions)

Snowpeak Trek 1400 Titanium (Lightweight cooking pot)

Goal Zero Venture 30 solar kit (Solar panel so that I can charge phone, gps, and lights along the way)

Pearl Izumi Elite Softshell shoe covers (It will be cold in Colorado, and possibly wet)

Schwalbe Marathon plus tour bike tires (My tires and tubes are just about at the end of their life, time for new ones!)

 

Lastly, is there anything that you will be giving back? For future trips I would very much like to do vlogs along the way, and I also have interest in biking for a specific cause, though I still would like to do research on that front. However, for this trip, my return will be a little bit more meager. No matter if you donate or not, definetly follow my Strava account which will show my progress everyday. As soon as I have Strava set up I will link it. If you donate 20$ or more then I will send you a postcard from somewhere along my journey. If you donate 70$ or more then you will get a postcard, and an “Artifact” from my trip. This artifact could range anywhere from a cool rock that I find, a picture that I take specifically for you, something unique that I find along the way, or maybe something else? The point is that it will be something catered just for you. For a 150$ donation I will send you a private email or text everyday talking about my adventure thus far. Keep in mind that there will be days that I will not have reception, but I will contact you as soon as I am able. The 250$ donation will get you everything above and then some. Not only will you receive a postcard, "Artifact", and personalized message every day, but you will also have access to my Strava beacon! This means that no matter what time, day or night, you will be able to track my every location! It will be as if you are right alongside me! However, be aware that there are only two of these perks available because Strava only allows up to 3 people to have access to the beacon, so supplies are extremely limited!  And the last donation level of 500$ (Don’t freak out, I don’t expect anyone to donate this individually) will of course get a postcard, an “Artifact”, and I will specifically design and plan a bike tour to come visit you wherever you may be. If you are planning on donating this amount I ask that you chat with me first so that we could discuss such a trip!

            Again, I want to give everyone a huge thank you. Your thoughts mean more than you know, and I hope that the adventures that I have ahead spark inspiration in you too.

-Dustin

 

“Then I breasted the snow again, crossed the muffled, shifting avalanche tali, forded the torrents in safety, and reached camp about dark, wet and weary, but rich in a notable experience.” -John Muir

 

"'I wish it need not have happened in my time,' said Frodo. 'So do I,' said Gandalf, 'and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.'" -J.R.R. Tolkien
story_txt: Dustin’s Phoenix Bike Tour!             Hey Friends and Family! I just wanted to start off by giving a big thank you for stopping by my Indiegogo page! I know that it is easy to get caught up in our lives, and I know that there are probably some of you that I have not spoken to in a while (we have to fix this error). I think it goes without saying that we often need to slow things down in order to appreciate our surroundings and each other, this is precisely why I am doing a bike tour from Denver Colorado to Phoenix Arizona. I also want to reiterate that if you are unable to, or choose not to back my trip that it is totally fine to check out what I am doing, and what adventures lie ahead. I hope too that my trip might inspire others to get out of their comfort zone and try new things. For the next few minutes I would like to do a quick overview of how I got into this adventure, and a brief outline of what I am doing, and where I am going. After that we will sum up what your donations will do for me, and lastly, what your donations will get you (I know that what I will be giving back is a bit meager, but I still hope that you enjoy it). What the heck am I doing, and how did I get into this mess? Both good questions! I am going to be riding my bicycle from the small town of Castle Rock near Denver to Phoenix Arizona. Most of my ride will be cutting through the southern part of the Rocky Mountains where I will then cycle through the Northwest portion of the Navajo Nation in New Mexico. I decided on Phoenix for a couple of reasons, the main one being that my brother Devan just moved out there last year and I want to go see him and Shannon and my nieces. I have also not explored this region of the United States very much and what better way to see it than on the saddle of a bicycle!!    But how did I decide to do this? Well last May I sold my vehicle and decided that I would commute to work full time and use my bicycle as my primary means of transportation. I ended the year with over 1200 miles commuted to work, not to mention cycling that I did on my free days. Needless to say I immediately fell in love with cycling and decided to try bike packing. Bikepacking is essentially backpacking but cycling instead of hiking (for the most part). I found this to be even more enjoyable than traditional backpacking because of the opportunities it opened to see more places and meet more people in a shorter amount of time. Immediately I began doing research on bike touring (mostly sticking to paved roads) and thus my trip to Phoenix spawned from that research! How long is my trip going to take? What will I be doing along the way? Expecting that I will take a day or two off from biking during my tour then I should be arriving on my 14th or 15th day. This is dependent on my pace of course, and it may alter slightly, but two week would be my goal! My daily average should hopefully be about 60 or 65 miles per day, however, some days that I have steep hill climbs will be much lower.Along the way I will mostly be camping with the exception of a few days where I will be staying with a host family and another day where I will be staying at a cheap hotsprings to get a much needed break from my hardest days of cycling. The rest will be free camping along the way that you can check out on the map back on my indiegogo page. This will no doubt be a tough trip mentally and physically, but I feel strong, and keeping you all in my thoughts will make me even stronger! Where will my money be going? The donations that you give to me will be going to two different things. One will be the last few pieces of gear that I need for my trip, and the other will be assisting in my personal expenses while I am gone. Though I do have some vacation time saved up, I do not have nearly enough to cover the entire trip (I will be taking off a month from work). The amount I am asking for in addition to the vacation time that I have accrued should allow me to do my trip and give me a slight cushion in case anything bad happens along the way. If I do end up getting more money than what I am asking then those funds will go towards my next bike touring adventure, so if you would like to make a donation but I have already hit my goal, don’t think that it won’t go towards the same cause. Throughout the last year and a half I have obtained most of the gear I will need on my trip, but what I still need are mostly essential items. Though I would sincerely appreciate gifts of these items, due to the nature of my job I can get good discounts on all said gear. The list is as follows:Ortlieb sport-packer plus (Main set of front panniers, I have already purchased the rear panniers)Revelate Designs Tangle bike frame bag (Bag for putting bike tools, snacks, and extra storage space)Garmin Explorer 820 (I have not 100% decided on this, and may change devicesMSR Pocket Rocket (Again, I may do a different burner depending on conditions)Snowpeak Trek 1400 Titanium (Lightweight cooking pot)Goal Zero Venture 30 solar kit (Solar panel so that I can charge phone, gps, and lights along the way)Pearl Izumi Elite Softshell shoe covers (It will be cold in Colorado, and possibly wet)Schwalbe Marathon plus tour bike tires (My tires and tubes are just about at the end of their life, time for new ones!) Lastly, is there anything that you will be giving back? For future trips I would very much like to do vlogs along the way, and I also have interest in biking for a specific cause, though I still would like to do research on that front. However, for this trip, my return will be a little bit more meager. No matter if you donate or not, definetly follow my Strava account which will show my progress everyday. As soon as I have Strava set up I will link it. If you donate 20$ or more then I will send you a postcard from somewhere along my journey. If you donate 70$ or more then you will get a postcard, and an “Artifact” from my trip. This artifact could range anywhere from a cool rock that I find, a picture that I take specifically for you, something unique that I find along the way, or maybe something else? The point is that it will be something catered just for you. For a 150$ donation I will send you a private email or text everyday talking about my adventure thus far. Keep in mind that there will be days that I will not have reception, but I will contact you as soon as I am able. The 250$ donation will get you everything above and then some. Not only will you receive a postcard, "Artifact", and personalized message every day, but you will also have access to my Strava beacon! This means that no matter what time, day or night, you will be able to track my every location! It will be as if you are right alongside me! However, be aware that there are only two of these perks available because Strava only allows up to 3 people to have access to the beacon, so supplies are extremely limited!  And the last donation level of 500$ (Don’t freak out, I don’t expect anyone to donate this individually) will of course get a postcard, an “Artifact”, and I will specifically design and plan a bike tour to come visit you wherever you may be. If you are planning on donating this amount I ask that you chat with me first so that we could discuss such a trip!            Again, I want to give everyone a huge thank you. Your thoughts mean more than you know, and I hope that the adventures that I have ahead spark inspiration in you too.-Dustin “Then I breasted the snow again, crossed the muffled, shifting avalanche tali, forded the torrents in safety, and reached camp about dark, wet and weary, but rich in a notable experience.” -John Muir "'I wish it need not have happened in my time,' said Frodo. 'So do I,' said Gandalf, 'and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us.'" -J.R.R. Tolkien

story:
With Years of Research and Development, our skates are the most Portable All-Mountain Wintersport Equipment ever Developed. 

Order now to GET 20% OFF your HALDEN Skates and enjoy Discounted Shipping!

Ultra Comfort Liner, Steelgrip Edges and High Ankle Support, make our skates not only ridiculously comfy but also Supportive at high speeds and over rough terrain.

Our Hardflex system promotes Flexibility to the core skate structure during Touring, and Advanced Maneuverability when the terrain and speed demand it. 

Watch Full Video : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iu01zdYJDIs

We are the only SKATES ON SNOW manufacturer, Supported & Backed by the Broader  Professional Hockey, Figure, Inline Skate community.  

ANDREI LAVROV - PRO COACH

Pro Ice Hockey Coach Andrei Lavrov swaps the ice rink for the ski slope with Sled Dogs Snowskates and demonstrates how ice hockey players can improve their stride and fitness levels – and have fun! – in an exciting new environment. 

ARRON ASHAM - NHL

Arron Asham, is a 15 year NHL Veteran with stops in Montreal, Penguins, Islanders, Rangers, Devils & the Flyers. Pro Skates on Snow Ambassador.
 
PJ DIMARTINO & JOHN SCHIAVO
John Schiavo & PJ DiMartino are both Pro Ice and Inline Hockey players.

Race in the Bonefight, 1st of its kind Downhill Alpine Race on Skates

If we hit $100K we are going to bring the Bonefight to the USA and create a North America race circuit to face off against the European Division. 

The Fastest Snowskaters

Clock Speeds over 60 MPH.

 The same moves you make on ice skates you can make on Sled Dogs Snowskates. 

LUNDE : https://youtu.be/bzASQurNfjs
    HYGEN : https://youtu.be/ER99ScTGO6A
  HALDEN : https://youtu.be/ovPlskz5VSk

We get it, picking a pair of skates for this winter is an exciting but challenging task. We are here to help! Below, you will find a breakdown of the skates we offer! If you have any additional questions you can chat with us at usasleddogs.com or email us at info@d49ak.com. 

Halden : Our trusty intro skate, the Halden is great for beginners and youth. Its dependable design with flexible sizing offers the best option for this group. Beginners, are defined by us as anyone entirely new to winter sports or to skating on ice. If you are an advanced ice skater, roller blader or inline hockey player you are already good at skating on snow and just don't know it yet so Halden would not be a great option for you. However, if you have very limited experience skating on ice and or haven't been to the slopes before Halden is perfect for you.

Lunde : The Lunde is very popular with the ladies as it is equipped with an ultra soft inner liner, aluminum buckles and stylish exterior. It is great for both beginners and intermediate riders. Most customers who buy this skate love the extra comforts and are figure skaters and or enjoy just touring the slopes in style.

Hygen : The Hygen is part of our intermediate/advanced skate lineup. Great for both men and women, the Hygen is a charger. Aggressive down the slopes its stiffer profile gives the rider access to more speed and tighter turns. An excellent choice for intermediate/advanced on ice skaters i.e. hockey players, figure skaters and advanced recreational skaters.  

K9.02 : Designed for the true mad dog, the K9.02 is built for speed and performance. It comes equipped with a heat moldable EPS liner, shock absorbing insole and all aluminum hardware. It is the top choice of advanced on/off ice skaters.

 

If you have any Questions about Sizing we are available to help 24hrs a day during the Campaign at 1-800-589-1767 or via Chat at usasleddogs.com

story:
The Lounge Wagon™ by Malo'o is an all-terrain utility wagon that converts to a double chair and umbrella so you can easily haul your gear, then kick back and enjoy your time in the shade. 

It’s perfect for your day at the beach, lake, park, sports field, or any place you want to haul gear and have somewhere comfortable to sit when you arrive.

TAKE IT EASY

Listen, we get it. Carrying chairs, toys, boogie boards, towels, umbrellas, ice chests, fishing poles, and the little ones can be a challenge. You’re either dropping items along the way or making multiple trips. And trying to drag a cart with small tires over sand and uneven ground isn’t any better. We knew there had to be a better way, so we created it. 

Lounge Wagon is a 3-in-1 sports wagon, double chair, and umbrella that makes hauling all your gear simple so you can sit back and enjoy when you get there. 

• Durable, all-terrain utility wagon large enough to hold your gear

• Comfortable double beach chair with head and armrests

• Double wide umbrella for complete shade

• Large, sport wheels that roll easily over sand, dirt, gravel, or uneven roadway

• Removable netting system to keep everything in its place

• Folds flat and buckles closed for easy transport – compact enough to fit in most car trunks, SUVs, or that minivan 

• Multiple pockets and storage spots to hold phones, drinks, keys, wallets, and more 

ABOUT MALO'O

Malo’o was started in early 2016 with a mission to help outdoor adventurers enjoy more of what they love doing through durable, portable, and versatile outdoor gear. It began with a simple and efficient way to dry and hold gear while on the go. Since then, our product line has expanded to include dry bags & duffels, backpack coolers, parkas & changing robes, seat covers, and fishing apparel. Malo’o products are proprietary, patented, manufactured to the highest standards, and sold throughout the world.  

THE LOUNGERS 

We’re Phil Kelly, founder and owner of Malo’o, Chris Crawford, founder, and inventor of RinseKit. We are avid adventurers and also like spending time outdoors with our families. Who knew that walking barefoot over razor-sharp rocks – while carrying a surfboard – would be easier than hauling toys and snacks for a family beach day? Ok, maybe that’s an exaggeration, but you get the picture. 

With several companies and many successful products developed between the two of us, we got to work together on something new. Something that would change the way we carried our stuff and how we enjoyed our time once we got there. 

THE IDEA

It all began with trying to take beach chairs, towels, coolers, bags, sand toys, boogie boards, umbrellas, and a 5 and 1-year-old to the beach. Let’s face it; if you have kids, you’ve been there. 

We’re both surfers who’ve traveled the world for the perfect wave, but going to the beach with groms is a totally different story. We knew we needed to bring innovation and efficiency to this problem—a new way to haul our gear and enjoy our time outdoors. 

A wagon that wasn’t just a wagon. It needed to be durable, collapsible, and easy to use. It definitely needed all-terrain wheels so it could be easily pulled through the sand or over rocks. And it needed a way to keep everything in place. A bonus if it was easy to put things in and take them out. We also wanted to seat two adults, provide them with shade, and have places to store personal items. 

We had our list of requirements, so we started designing and ultimately developed Lounge Wagon: a 3-in-1 utility wagon, double chair, and umbrella.  

DURABLE WAGON. COMFORTABLE CHAIR. 

The design process started with putting together computer models of what we wanted to build. We had to figure out how the cart sides would convert into a chair or fold away. Then we worked on the chassis (the base frame for the wheels) and the steering mechanism. We took our time with determining the best wheels for sand and other rocky surfaces. Next came the balance. We needed to make sure the seat held two full-size adults and wouldn’t tip over. 

We made prototypes and added real-time info on what worked and what didn’t.  Our prototype was a great chair but lacked some of the wagon utility we wanted. Our second was a better wagon but we took a step back on the lounging comfort. We kept improving each area through the next several prototypes until we had a working prototype that met our goals. 

We’re proud of what we’ve developed. Still, We are committed to continually make improvements throughout this Kickstarter campaign,  the manufacturing period, and the extensive QC period so that you receive the best Lounge Wagon possible. We will be posting improvements and updates throughout the process. 

SPECS

 

 Lounge Wagon measures 45” long, 23” wide, 23” high, and stands 34” tall from the bottom of the wheels to the top of the sides. The umbrella is 32” high and 10 feet wide! Plenty of shade for both people. 

Made to Move 

When it comes to sand and uneven terrain, many wagons can’t hack it. Lounge Wagon’s all-terrain rubber wheels are made to move across sand, dirt, and rocky pavement so it can easily steer and haul your gear almost anywhere you go. 

Easy Set-Up

No Ph.D. is required. Pull up the side of the Lounge Wagon to form the cart. Fold it down for the base of the chair when you’re ready to relax. The included cargo netting securely stores items, and the UPF 50+ umbrella attaches easily at the back of the chair. 

Built to Last

Lounge Wagon is made from corrosion-resistant materials and designed to hold up to 500 lbs. The durable 600D polyester fabric sides securely store your goods, and the bright blue color looks good too. You’ll be rolling up in style (see what we did there?). As a wagon, it’s made for strength and durability. As a chair, it’s comfortable and stable for two full-grown adults – no tipping over! 

 

REWARDS

We need your help – back Lounge Wagon today! We believe in our product and think it is the best way to haul your gear and enjoy more of what you love to do. Be among the first to get your own Lounge Wagon (including umbrella and cargo net) with the pledge amounts below.

Take it easy with Lounge Wagon: the 3-in-1 utility wagon, double beach chair, and umbrella.

TIMELINE

We’ve already made several prototypes and are ready to move forward. Here’s our expected timeline for production and shipping to backers. 

August 1, 2020 – Kickstarter Launch

September 1, 2020 – Kickstarter Campaign Completed

September / October 2020 – Tooling and Pre-Production Runs

November 2020 – Production Begins

January 2021 – Production Complete

February 2021 – Finalize Backer Information, Manufacturer, Sea Shipment to Malo’o

March 2021 – Ship to Backers

JOIN OUR 'OHANA

Ohana means “family” in Hawaiian, and, at Malo’o, our customers are part of our family. 

The Malo’o Ohana (community) are passionate outdoor enthusiasts, and they are the reason we exist. Through their support and encouragement, we have continually grown and expanded throughout our first 5 years continually!

We believe Lounge Wagon is another great gear innovation that enables our adventurers to do more of what they really love to do. Please help us spread the word and make Lounge Wagon a reality!

Please join us on Instagram, Facebook,  Twitter, Pinterest, or YouTube for updates on all of our great outdoor products. 

WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING

"Before, I had to make several trips to the car to get everything for our day at the beach with our four children when my husband was at work. Now, it's just one! I still have the youngest in my arms, but the wagon is so easy to pull, it's not an issue. Thanks, Lounge Wagon!                                                                                    - Ash W., Laguna Beach, CA

"We bought 3 different wagons before trying the Lounge Wagon. They either didn't hold enough, could not make it through the sand with a load, or didn't work. The Lounge Wagon is great with how it converts to a double-seat and umbrella… a great idea. Bonus: great for our kid's sporting events too!”                 - Nate S., San Diego, CA

"...amazing, I figured the seat would be uncomfortable as it looks more like a wagon...was I wrong. Good job, guys, I can sit here for hours!"    - Nick K., Scottsdale, AZ.

The included cargo netting securely stores items, and the UPF 50+ umbrella attaches easily at the back of the chair. Built to LastLounge Wagon is made from corrosion-resistant materials and designed to hold up to 500 lbs. The durable 600D polyester fabric sides securely store your goods, and the bright blue color looks good too. You’ll be rolling up in style (see what we did there?). As a wagon, it’s made for strength and durability. As a chair, it’s comfortable and stable for two full-grown adults – no tipping over!  REWARDSWe need your help – back Lounge Wagon today! We believe in our product and think it is the best way to haul your gear and enjoy more of what you love to do. Be among the first to get your own Lounge Wagon (including umbrella and cargo net) with the pledge amounts below.Take it easy with Lounge Wagon: the 3-in-1 utility wagon, double beach chair, and umbrella.
 
 
 TIMELINEWe’ve already made several prototypes and are ready to move forward. Here’s our expected timeline for production and shipping to backers. August 1, 2020 – Kickstarter LaunchSeptember 1, 2020 – Kickstarter Campaign CompletedSeptember / October 2020 – Tooling and Pre-Production RunsNovember 2020 – Production BeginsJanuary 2021 – Production CompleteFebruary 2021 – Finalize Backer Information, Manufacturer, Sea Shipment to Malo’oMarch 2021 – Ship to Backers JOIN OUR 'OHANAOhana means “family” in Hawaiian, and, at Malo’o, our customers are part of our family. The Malo’o Ohana (community) are passionate outdoor enthusiasts, and they are the reason we exist. Through their support and encouragement, we have continually grown and expanded throughout our first 5 years continually!We believe Lounge Wagon is another great gear innovation that enables our adventurers to do more of what they really love to do. Please help us spread the word and make Lounge Wagon a reality!  Please join us on Instagram, Facebook,  Twitter, Pinterest, or YouTube for updates on all of our great outdoor products. WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING "Before, I had to make several trips to the car to get everything for our day at the beach with our four children when my husband was at work. Now, it's just one! I still have the youngest in my arms, but the wagon is so easy to pull, it's not an issue. Thanks, Lounge Wagon!                                                                                    - Ash W., Laguna Beach, CA"We bought 3 different wagons before trying the Lounge Wagon. They either didn't hold enough, could not make it through the sand with a load, or didn't work. The Lounge Wagon is great with how it converts to a double-seat and umbrella… a great idea. Bonus: great for our kid's sporting events too!”                 - Nate S., San Diego, CA"...amazing, I figured the seat would be uncomfortable as it looks more like a wagon...was I wrong. Good job, guys, I can sit here for hours!"    - Nick K., Scottsdale, AZ.                                                                                                      
 
Alaska & Hawaii
Unfortunately, we cannot ship to these locations currently due to freight costs. 
Risks and ChallengesThis isn’t our first rodeo. Both inventors of Lounge Wagon have had successful Kickstarter campaigns (Chris Crawford for RinseKit, Phil Kelly for Malo'o). And both campaigns delivered all products to all of the campaign supporters. Additionally, we have thousands of customers in countries worldwide and are experienced in bringing new products to the market. Together, we’ve developed and delivered hundreds of different products with our production and design partners over the last several years. We know what it takes to make quality products, bring them to market and deliver them to customers. We may be two Southern California surfers, but we also get the job done and put in the office hours.
We are utilizing exacting manufacturing standards and materials, but there are risks and challenges with any new product. We are taking every measure to control what we can, but there are some things out of everyone’s control with anything in life. Some possible worst-case scenarios: the factory could close due to the pandemic, the freight containers could be lost at sea, or some other unpredictable event could delay production or Lounge Wagon delivery. Quality Control is super important to us, so if there are any ,QC issues, it could extend the delivery times.
These conditions are extreme and ones that every product potentially faces. That’s why a dedicated support team that will always go above and beyond is in place to find a solution. Lounge Wagon has gone through several iterations, and concrete plans are now in place for its production. We have CAD files. We have a manufacturer lined up. We are confident that we will be able to deliver a product that will live up to the demands of your next adventure, even if that’s trekking across a blazing hot parking lot and three football fields of sand to find the perfect spot.
Mahalo,Phil & Chris

story:
Outdoor Recovery Project

The OUTDOOR RECOVERY PROJECT seeks to add spiritual, emotional and physical wellness to the lives of persons recovering from alcoholism and addiction through meaningful outdoor recreation and adventure. This includes, hiking, kayaking, canoeing, cross country and downhill skiing, and snowboarding. We have the skills to teach and guide we just lack the funds to get moving.

Many in recovery face the challenging task of finding meaningful activities in new lives free from alcohol and drugs. Adding to this, many in the recovering community simply don’t know where to start when working to fully enjoy a life free of alcohol and drugs. Still others simply lack the knowledge or tools at hand to engage in outdoor recreational activities. That’s why we’re here… we’re here to help, we’re here to have fun!

What We Need & What You Get

The funds will allow our group to get off our feet by giving us much needed programming dollars for our first year, and the funds will help us to establish our 501 c3 status and...

The funds will specifically be used for gear rentals and expenses for hiking, skiing, kayaking, canoeing, and taking recovering folk on day ski and snowboarding trips. We provide the transportation, guiding, and training but for now we'll need to rent the gear.


Take a look at our donation levels and perks!

The Impact

The OUTDOOR RECOVERY PROJECT arose from the need to take a more holistic approach to personal recovery by embracing the often overlooked physical element of health. A small group of recovering addicts and alcoholics recognized the many benefits of recreation, outdoor adventure, fellowship, and fitness when added to a program of recovery. They then sought deeper fellowship through outdoor experiences and worked to find a way to share this with other recovering alcoholics and addicts.

  • Outdoor recreation and adventure has been shown to improve the lives of recovering persons and aid in relapse prevention.
  • Our leadership group is comprised of avid hikers, cyclists, kayaking enthusuasts, skiiers, snowboarders, triathletes and runners. We're made up entirely of recovering persons.
  • We're already doing this on a person to person basis but want to spread the love to the entire region of recovering alcoholics and addicts.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Like us on Facebook and help spread the word: https://www.facebook.com/OutdoorRecoveryProject
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Who am I?

I am a 22 year-old business student and entrepreneur. I am passionate about innovation, social events, and fresh thinking!

Here's the deal:

Fishing is awesome. Snagging lures is not. Being an experienced fisherman myself, I have experienced this problem first-hand and created the Break Away Coupling to solve it. The Break Away Coupling is fully designed, patented, and ready for manufacturing. With your help I can build it and bring it to market!

Problem/Solution

Snagging lures is time consuming, expensive, and has a negative impact on the environment (we've all seen tangled fishing line next to a lake or river.)

BUT, the Break Away Coupling will solve these problems by causing the hook to break off the lure at a pre-determined rate of tension! Meaning, you only lose the hook, not the entire lure. Hooks are 50x cheaper to replace than lures, and the Speed Snap design allows fishermen to re-attach a new hook in under 10 seconds!

A question I'm often asked is this: If I catch a big fish will I lose it? No. Simply set your drag beneath the breaking point of the coupling and you will never lose fish because if this product. 

Why do I need your help?

Prototyping is expensive per-piece because it is generally a small quantity being produced. However, with your help, I will be able to raise enough enough funds and validate the market to attract larger investment funds. With this money I can bring the cost of the product down to a much more reasonable level.

If you think this product deserves a chance on the market, contribute to it!

Since I need money for inventory, anybody who helps me by giving at least $5 will get a sample of my product shipped to them (shipping is included in the cost, the lure is not!).

If my goal of 5000 units is not reached, any funds raised will go towards producing product for lab and field testing. Or, give me an idea for how YOU think it should be spent!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't still help.

Use the Indiegogo share tools to help me get the word out!

story:
Summary

More sailors will benefit from systems that are being tested in this project. There are a number of sailboats that have circumnavigated without an engine but the majority of the sailors would not attempt it.

With the systems being tested, peace of mind and convenience of sustainable power will be realized and promoted.

Current State

The Lady Lauren is currently "on the hard", meaning she is out of the water. All of the power systems are installed and the electronics are next. What remains is the removal of the old fossil fuel engine, cleaning the grease and grime, repainting the engine room and installation of the new propulsion system.

The Goal

The goal is to complete the refit and sea trials.  Solar and wind power will be the only energy systems onboard.

 

Systems:

Electric Propulsion

Solar heat, cooking and water distilling.

 

Tell your friends about us and help us acheive our goals!

story:
Hi Everyone! We will be going on a mission trip to Nicaragua and have made this Indiegogo campaign to share with you the details of our trip. Please watch the video above or read on below. Thanks!

For the past ten years we have been blessed to be part of Trinity church here in Bozeman, MT and this June, we will travel with ten others from our church on a mission trip to Nicaragua for one week. We are partnering with a missionary family, the Lathrops who minister within an impoverished community outside of Managua.

Robbie and Murray Lathrop are missionaries who purchased a pineapple farm called “Piñas de Paz” (Pineapples of Peace) with a desire to meet the tremendous spiritual and physical needs of the Nicaraguan people. They are using the farm as a ministry site for training, teaching, community outreach and evangelism.

During our time in Nicaragua we will be doing construction, vacation Bible school, hospital and house visits to the poor, and serving in any other way they need us. We pray that our team will be a blessing and vehicle through which God’s grace can flow freely. 

The cost of the mission trip is $3,800 which includes our expenses and project supplies. If the Lord leads you to contribute, any amount of financial support is welcome. Every little bit helps and together we can put our resources at the disposal of the Kingdom.

Thanks for reading this far. :-)

Please keep us in your prayers as we prepare for this mission trip.

If you’d like to support us financially, you can do so on the right of the screen.

NOTE: If you would prefer to support us financially with a check, all checks should be made to “Trinity Church”, and be careful not to write our names anywhere on the check for tax purposes.  All donations to Trinity Church are tax-deductible.

Checks can be mailed to:

Jared & Nichole Joyce
1012 West Babcock
Bozeman, MT 59715

Thanks for your prayers and financial support!

story:
Hello, my name is Joe Schmidt, I am a physics teacher, surfer and owner of Cape May Surf Club, llc. in Cape May County, NJ.  Every year, I, along with two other teachers, organize a surfing and eco-tourism trip to Tamarindo, Costa Rica.  We are running this campaign to help our kids experience more of the diverse attributes of Costa Rica. 

     Our mission is to create an opportunity for kids to surf world class waves and experience diverse cultures by traveling to exotic destinations as cheaply as possible.  This year we would like to take the entire group of 30 on a volcano tour at lake Arenal, zip lining through the rainforest, and a snorkeling adventure to a beach front reef.  We need $4500 to fund the three separate excursions.  Each excursion costs $50 per student.  All money raised will go directly to paying for these opportunities.

     The Impact of this trip can be felt at many different levels, from the cash infusion into the Costa Rica economy to life long memories of a tropical rainforest.  2014 will be our 5th group trip to Costa Rica.  Two former surf club members, after traveling with us twice, actually moved to Costa Rica to surf and teach abroad. Many of our students will attend college majoring in an environmental field such as marine biology or green engineering.  The Costa Rica trip represents a chance for the kids to experience first-hand animals and plants of the rainforest and these experiences have directly helped to shape their viewpoints on conservation and protection of this great planet.  The experiences you fund will create a learning environment for a truly motivated group.

     If you cannot support our campaign financially, we would really appreciate it if you could pass our campaign along to your friends through Indiegogo’s sharing tools. 

     Thank you again for your support, we truly appreciate every dollar this campaign raises, and any support you can give in passing along our campaign.

story:
Evergreen Mountain Bike Alliance Trail Machine

Update, August 12:  We've been meeting and doing detailed project planning.  We've made the decision to buy two excavators.   The total cost for two machines is $75,000, we'll use donated funds, general funds from Evergreen, and financing to buy them (see below for details).

This decision was an easy one due to a combination of the amazing support from this fundraiser, and the economics of renting versus buying.  Read further down for more details on the revised plan.  Thank you for your support!

We are a highly effective nonprofit dedicated to creating and protecting mountain bike opportunities in Washington State. 

We just announced five new trail projects for a total of 60 miles of new singletrack over the next two years.  The trail construction is starting right now.  It's time for Evergreen to buy two reliable, new excavators of our own.


Mike Westra, our Trail Program Director, sitting on a shiny new Kubota excavator.
We usually rent a machine or two for each project, but we now have enough work that owning a machine makes good financial sense.  This isn't just spending, it's an investment in future singletrack for you.

The Olallie State Park project will be at high elevation and a major break down could mean paying tens of thousands of dollars to helicopter the machine out.  Now is the time for an ultra-reliable new machine.

Help us buy a Kubota KX018 Excavator

The new excavator, custom thumb, frost ripper and tax will cost $35,259.  This is with a 14% nonprofit/government discount from Kubota. The trailer will be around $4000, maybe less if we can find used one.  Total cost is $39,259.

We are getting the model with an enclosed cab and heater so crews can work through miserable winter conditions and build trail year round.  It is a 2 ton mini-excavator, and track width is adjustable from 4’3” down to 3’3”, allowing for both stability on steep slopes and narrow trail.

Our goal is to raise at least $20,000, and Evergreen will cover the other half of the cost from our general fund. 

Let's think even bigger!  If we raise $30,000, we'll also buy a UTV such as a Gator to get our crews and gear in and out of remote trail building sites.

We're going to build you a lot of new singletrack!
August 12 Update:  The plan to buy two excavators.

We’ve been doing detailed planning for our upcoming projects, and it’s become clear that buying a second excavator is the smart thing to do for Evergreen, and we’ve found a way to do it.  So you heard this right, we’re buying two excavators.

We are going to purchase a second KX018 excavator of the same model/specs, receiving about $3.5k discount for purchasing them together. This makes sense for maintenance and common spare parts.

We'll have up to five excavators running at a time over the next two years.  We'll rent any additional excavators from Hertz, which has been a great partner of ours through their US Communities program for nonprofits.

We'll put approximately $40,000 down of the total $75,500 cost and finance the balance with two-year financing.  Any funds we raise beyond $20,000 will increase the down payment, and the balance of funds will be paid out of Evergreen's general fund. The machines will have an expected 8-10 year life under the conditions that we operate. 

Buying the two machines is an investment in our trails programs and compared to renting we will recover the cost within the first 2-3 years.  We will continue to rent additional machines we need beyond the two we own, depending on project needs.  This hits the right balance for us of the good economics of owning, cash management, and the flexibility of renting.  After the current 2-3 year surge in projects we're confident we can keep two machines running.


Donor Recognition

Title Sponsor – name on both sides of boom:  1 available at $3000. Project 529 Legion has one Title Sponsorship, and one more is available now that we're buying two machines.
Secondary Sponsor – name on both sides of boom: 1 available at $2000. Crank Sisters has one Secondary Sponsorship, and one more is available now that we're buying two machines.  
Sponsors – 24 characters: 8 available at $650.  Plus a t-shirt.
Sponsors – 14 characters: 10 available at $500.  Plus a t-shirt.
$250+ sponsors – get your name printed in a list, fixed to back or front of machine, plus a t-shirt.
$100 donors –  t-shirt with an excavator-themed design.

Once the fundraiser is complete we'll reach out to you via email and get your sizing info for the t-shirt.

Evergreen Mountain Bike Alliance is a 501(c)3 nonprofit, so your donation may be tax deductible to the extend allowed by the law.

You can have your name, business name, team name, or any short message that is subject to our approval.  Nothing lewd or offensive, and Evergreen reserves the right to approve sponsors.  Title and secondary sponsors get to have their logo and name on the boom.

Updated image showing accurate sponsorship levels.
Your name/message will be applied via a vinyl sticker, they will get trashed, and we won’t be replacing them.  We’re going to use the heck out of this machine.  We’ll keep the stickers on there for three years.



More Trails!

Evergreen Mountain Bike Alliance has successfully designed and constructed many trails in Washington, both hand-built and machine-built.  Our crews are widely recognized as some the best trail designers and builders in the country.  Examples of our past projects include Duthie Hill Park and East Tiger Summit Trail on Tiger Mountain.

We work by securing government approval and government grants to build trail on public land, and occasionally get a contract to build trail on private land.


The last several years we have been working with our government partners on some exciting new projects, and five of these projects have been approved, which will result in 60 miles of new singletrack with construction beginning now.  Here are the five projects that are about to start.

Issaquah: East Tiger Mountain - 6 more miles of singletrack beyond what's in the works right now.
 
Issaquah: Raging River State Forest - 14 mile loop is funded and we'll start construction now, with 40 miles approved in the future.  Raging is across Highway 18 from Tiger Mountain, and the two systems will connect as part of a later phase.
 
Darrington: North Mountain - 20 mile stacked loop plus a family-friendly "trail park".
 
Skykomish: Alpine Baldy - 15 mile out-and-back ride with stunning alpine views.
 
North Bend: Ollalie Trail - 17 mile out-and-back with 2500 feet of vert.


Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can donate money, but there are lots of ways to support Evergreen Mountain Bike Alliance

  • Spread the word about this campaign!  It ends soon, so tell your friends.
  • Use the share tools to tell others about this Indiegogo campaign.
  • Join an Evergreen Event or Work Party.
  • Become a member of Evergreen Mountain Bike Alliance.

Thank you for helping us build you miles, and miles of new mountain bike trails!

About our Team

Evergreen Mountain Bike Alliance is a nonprofit dedicated to creating and protection mountain bike opportunities in Washington State.

Justin Vander Pol is VP of the Evergreen Mountain Bike Alliance Board of Directors, and is an avid trail designer and builder.  He is leading the campaign to buy Evergreen a new excavator.

Mike Westra runs Evergreen's Trail Program, and is the mad genius behind many of the mountain bike trails you live in Washington State.  Mike has eight highly skilled trail builders working for him on multiple projects including bike parks, epic high-country trails, DH tracks, and everything in between.

Kari Lio, Mike Bockner and Board President Carolyn Hope are the driving force behind Evergreen's fundraising efforts, which allow us to build you so much amazing new trail.

The trailer will be around $4000, maybe less if we can find used one.  Total cost is $39,259.We are getting the model with an enclosed cab and heater so crews can work through miserable winter conditions and build trail year round.  It is a 2 ton mini-excavator, and track width is adjustable from 4’3” down to 3’3”, allowing for both stability on steep slopes and narrow trail.Our goal is to raise at least $20,000, and Evergreen will cover the other half of the cost from our general fund.  Let's think even bigger!  If we raise $30,000, we'll also buy a UTV such as a Gator to get our crews and gear in and out of remote trail building sites.
We're going to build you a lot of new singletrack!
August 12 Update:  The plan to buy two excavators.
We’ve been doing detailed planning for our
upcoming projects, and it’s become clear that buying a second excavator is the
smart thing to do for Evergreen, and we’ve found a way to do it.  So you heard this right, we’re buying two excavators.
We are going to purchase a second
KX018 excavator of the same model/specs, receiving about $3.5k discount for
purchasing them together. This makes sense for maintenance and common spare
parts.
We'll have up to five excavators
running at a time over the next two years.  We'll rent any additional
excavators from Hertz, which has been a great partner of ours through their US
Communities program for nonprofits.
We'll put approximately $40,000 down
of the total $75,500 cost and finance the balance with two-year
financing.  Any funds we raise beyond $20,000 will increase the down
payment, and the balance of funds will be paid out of Evergreen's general fund.
The machines will have an expected 8-10 year life under the conditions that we
operate.  
Buying the two machines is an
investment in our trails programs and compared to renting we will recover the
cost within the first 2-3 years.  We will continue to rent additional
machines we need beyond the two we own, depending on project needs.  This
hits the right balance for us of the good economics of owning, cash management,
and the flexibility of renting.  After the current 2-3 year surge in
projects we're confident we can keep two machines running.
Donor RecognitionTitle Sponsor – name on both sides of boom:  1 available at $3000. Project 529 Legion has one Title Sponsorship, and one more is available now that we're buying two machines.Secondary Sponsor – name on both sides of boom: 1 available at $2000. Crank Sisters has one Secondary Sponsorship, and one more is available now that we're buying two machines.   Sponsors – 24 characters: 8 available at $650.  Plus a t-shirt.Sponsors – 14 characters: 10 available at $500.  Plus a t-shirt.$250+ sponsors – get your name printed in a list, fixed to back or front of machine, plus a t-shirt.$100 donors –  t-shirt with an excavator-themed design.Once the fundraiser is complete we'll reach out to you via email and get your sizing info for the t-shirt.Evergreen Mountain Bike Alliance is a 501(c)3 nonprofit, so your donation may be tax deductible to the extend allowed by the law.You can have your name, business name, team name, or any short message that is subject to our approval.  Nothing lewd or offensive, and Evergreen reserves the right to approve sponsors.  Title and secondary sponsors get to have their logo and name on the boom. Updated image showing accurate sponsorship levels.
Your name/message will be applied via a vinyl sticker, they will get trashed, and we won’t be replacing them.  We’re going to use the heck out of this machine.  We’ll keep the stickers on there for three years. More Trails!
Evergreen Mountain Bike Alliance has successfully designed and constructed many trails in Washington, both hand-built and machine-built.  Our crews are widely recognized as some the best trail designers and builders in the country.  Examples of our past projects include Duthie Hill Park and East Tiger Summit Trail on Tiger Mountain.We work by securing government approval and government grants to build trail on public land, and occasionally get a contract to build trail on private land.
The last several years we have been working with our government partners on some exciting new projects, and five of these projects have been approved, which will result in 60 miles of new singletrack with construction beginning now.  Here are the five projects that are about to start.Issaquah: East Tiger Mountain - 6 more miles of singletrack beyond what's in the works right now. Issaquah: Raging River State Forest - 14 mile loop is funded and we'll start construction now, with 40 miles approved in the future.  Raging is across Highway 18 from Tiger Mountain, and the two systems will connect as part of a later phase. Darrington: North Mountain - 20 mile stacked loop plus a family-friendly "trail park". Skykomish: Alpine Baldy - 15 mile out-and-back ride with stunning alpine views. North Bend: Ollalie Trail - 17 mile out-and-back with 2500 feet of vert.
Other Ways You Can Help

 Not everyone can donate money, but there are lots of ways to support Evergreen Mountain Bike Alliance  Spread the word about this campaign!  It ends soon, so tell your friends.
 Use the share tools to tell others about this Indiegogo campaign.
Join an Evergreen Event or Work Party.

Become a member of Evergreen Mountain Bike Alliance.
   Thank you for helping us build you miles, and miles of new mountain bike trails!About our TeamEvergreen Mountain Bike Alliance is a nonprofit dedicated to creating and protection mountain bike opportunities in Washington State. Justin Vander Pol is VP of the Evergreen Mountain Bike Alliance Board of Directors, and is an avid trail designer and builder.  He is leading the campaign to buy Evergreen a new excavator.Mike Westra runs Evergreen's Trail Program, and is the mad genius behind many of the mountain bike trails you live in Washington State.  Mike has eight highly skilled trail builders working for him on multiple projects including bike parks, epic high-country trails, DH tracks, and everything in between.Kari Lio, Mike Bockner and Board President Carolyn Hope are the driving force behind Evergreen's fundraising efforts, which allow us to build you so much amazing new trail.

story:
Hello

Thank you for considering our mission and for your interest in helping us achieve our goal of going on a mission trip together.


KaytLyn is the inspiration and drive for this campaign. Her dream is to travel around the world helping those in need. At 12 years old she has some pretty high goals, and is very compassionate for others. Last fall we learned of a mission group "Never the Same Mission" through our church. KaytLyn listened intently to the speaker and her words filled her mind and heart with a desire to attend one of these trips.

I am too protective to send my little girl out of the country without momma, and quite honestly the images and words that were spoken about this sent my mind on a whirlwind of thoughts and ideas, also. We were both on the same page after service and we had one goal in mind. We were going to go on a mission trip together!

By helping fund this trip you are doing so much more than helping pay for us to travel. It goes far beyond the idea that we get to see foreign land and meet new people. Your help is giving way to a dream; a future. KaytLyn has a passion for helping others. Please help me in supporting her and the desire to follow God's command for her. She talks of being a missionary someday, and I believe that this is only the beginning.

The total cost of the trip will be approximately $6000 for both of us to attend:

 

Airfare to and from Miami, FL

Accommodations in Miami for sponsor (chaperone) training

Airfare to and from Lima, Peru

2 week room and board in Lima

All transfer fees and taxes

Passport fees for Kaytlyn (I already have one)

 

While in Peru we will visit schools, orphanages, poverty-stricken neighborhoods, parks, markets, and other community areas and meet the people of Lima. We will be providing them with drama ministry as well as completing service projects in their neighborhoods. Each evening the group will meet for a time of reflection on the work that God is doing in our hearts as we help others.

 

If we don't reach our initial goal of $1000 it's okay! We have a fund account setup with a payee that will collect the money and it will continue to build as more donations come in toward our goal. We are only able to run 60 days at a time on indiegogo.com so we will be initializing another campaign in a few months.

 

If you are located in our local area you can also help through the purchase goods that we make and sell. You can find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/ksheavenlycreations/?ref=ts&fref=ts

 

We made handmade chocolate covered treats for just about any occasion. Check us out and place an order today; 100% of the proceeds go to help fund this event.

 

Please share this with your family, friends, neighbors, and coworkers. Facebook is a great sharing tool, and most of you are already on! There are share tools right on the Indiegogo site that will link our page to yours and your friends will be informed instantly.

Thank you in advance. No donation is too small. If you cannot make a financial contribution, we ask that you please pray for us as we set sail on this journey and strive to reach this goal.


Blessings, 

Angel & KaytLyn

story:
Innovation results from using a little creativity to solve life’s problems. In my case, I needed something small enough to attach to a zipper or keychain yet, sharp enough to slice through daily tasks. And thus, the Bandit Titanium keychain locking pocket knife was born.


At the mere size of your standard house key, the Bandit Titanium is discreet. Slide it in your jeans’ coin pocket. Throw it on your bundle of keys. Heck, attach it to the zipper of your favorite jacket. I've attached one to my zipper of my fishing pouch. This folding knife makes a statement without having to announce it.

Despite its miniature size, the Bandit Titanium can take on tasks that are too big for lesser pocket knives or small cutting tools. It can slice through annoying heat-sealed packaging, cut persistent zip ties, and even whittle a pencil to a nice sharp point.

An everyday carry tool needs to be able to withstand your everyday grind, so we’ve built the Bandit out of some tough stuff: 

  • The body is made of Grade 5 Titanium, a metal known for its strength and minimal weight.
  • The blade is made of hardened AUS-8 Stainless Steel.
  • The pivot and lever is made of stainless steel as well.

Every component is made with the tightest tolerances, resulting in a strong, sturdy and lightweight knife that will endure the worst.

How Is it Built?

The pivot post and lever is the mechanism that allows for the smooth opening and closing of the blade. It’s crucial to the life of the knife, so we’ve spent extra time ensuring that these parts were machined and cut with tight tolerances to deliver smooth, reliable action. There are no flimsy complicated metal parts. The pivot post can also be tightened as the blade wears to prevent blade play

The Shape

I’ve tried other knives of a similar size and found that they were just a novelty. It was tough to get a good grip on the thing for some practical cutting tasks. Other tools like razor blades just won't cut it as they are limited in their tasks and I didn't want to change blades. With the Bandit, functionality is the foremost priority. A fold out blade design, in addition to the lower notch and the flat spine offers you enough real estate for a better grip and provides adequate leverage for more difficult cutting tasks. Other tiny keychain tools do not have sufficient length for proper cutting.

The Bandit Titanium has a modern timeless design that features rounded corners for comfort and increased durability. Jimping (small grooves) found on the spine of the knife promotes grip during more strenuous tasks. At the bottom side, you’ll find the 4mm built-in loop that allows you to attach it to a key ring or lanyard. There is no need for any small split ring attachment.

The Blade

The blade is 1.2 inches long and is made from hardened AUS-8 Stainless Steel. The blade is heat treated to 58/60HRC, in addition it will go through a cryogenic process which removes residual stresses and improves wear resistance. We chose this metal for its ability to hold its edge for longer while also being easy to re-sharpen when needed. The blade thickness is a generous 2mm. You will never need to change a blade. Each Bandit is sharpened and ready to use right out of the box.

  • Blade thickness - 2mm with no blade changing & easy to re-sharpen
  • Made with hardened AUS-8 stainless steel
  • Comes sharp right out of the box

Quality

  • The Bandit is custom manufactured, meticulously machined, and hand finished.
  • Stainless steel pivot allows for a lifetime of use. 
  • Stainless steel lever mechanism is designed to withstand normal wear and tear. 
  • The blade is made for daily tasks and is ready to use right when you get it. 
  • Screw pivot can be tightened if needed but not any time soon.

Durability

  • Extremely durable with a rust-proof blade that holds a sharper edge for longer. 
  • The body is made of titanium that is strong and lightweight. 
  • Built to last. The Bandit can take a few punches.

Comfort

  • Small, compact and ultra-light. 
  • Rounded smooth corners to ensure comfort and no wear on pockets.
  • Doesn’t weigh down your keys, pocket or zipper. 

 Practicality

  • Slim locking blade that takes up minimal space and will not fold back on your fingers. 
  • Adds a productive tool to your everyday carry. 
  • Use it to open boxes or anything that requires more effort than your fingers. 
  • Cut, pry, pop and tighten. 
  • Flip out the blade for instant access in time of need. 
  • It is handy and may get more use than some of your keys. 
  • You will soon discover that it’s now an essential part of your everyday carry. 

The Bandit knife is designed to be a basic, do-everything blade that just happens to be housed in a simple eye-catching handle. No unnecessary add-ons, the single blade simply acts as your trusty sidekick in everyday life.

Why you need a small pocket knife?

 How many times have you been in a situation where you’ve said to yourself, “Heck, a knife would be really handy now!” Here are a few instances when a pocket knife can come in handy or just make the simple things in life more enjoyable: 

  • Open boxes 
  • Open letters 
  • Cut zip ties 
  • Cut cordage or twine 
  • Trim loose thread 
  • Sharpen a stick or a pencil 
  • Cut, pick, pry - many uses 
  • General small tasks

INDIEGOGO Price $36 Includes US Shipping

Retail Price $40 

Invest in a knife that you are proud to show off, is comfortable in your pocket, and one that reflects personality. A tiny little pocket knife that feels good in your hand, that you’ll take pride in and want to carry around plus won’t break the bank. It's tiny and titanium!

Production
We are currently in process of manufacturing the Bandit Titanium and offering it at a discounted price before they hit our retail shop at www.quietcarry.com. I would like to get the Bandit Titanium in as many hands as possible so you can see the quality first hand and second to get our manufacturing cost down to pass on these savings. I am really excited for the future of the company and The Bandit Titanium. If you have any questions don't hesitate to contact me here or at info@quietcarry.com. Thank you for your continued support! - Bryce

story:
Short Summary

  • You reached our alternative wedding gift registry.  For people that feel like they must give something we created a few options for you!
  • Bike trips are an important part of our lives.  It has been way too long since we spent any significant amount of time on our bikes exploring the world.  
  • Your contribution pushes us to do it again.  We can't keep using the excuse- we don't have the funds or time.... heck now we'll need to get off our #$%$ and make it happen!


What We Need & What You Get

  • The funds we receive will either go towards international bike rentals from Experience Plus Bicycle Tours in Fort Collins or towards the plane fare to ????.   We learned from our last trip... leave our bikes at home and rent them abroad from an outfit like Experience Plus.
  • Unique perks?   How many times do you get to help someone buy a bike trip? For any contributor, we'll send you a link to our trip pictures.   
  • Even if we don't reach our goal your contribution will be used towards our next bike adventure.  (Isn't this so much better then going to Bed Bath and Beyond for wedding registry?)

The Impact

  • This project is valuable because it will build lasting memories rather then accumulating more stuff
  • We've taken a few bike trips together already and survived!  Some might even say we had fun. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign and the joy of not buying more stuff for people's weddings. 

    And that's all there is to it.

story:
"A Telepresence Robot with a Gripping Arm? ORIGIBOT Is a Dream Come True"


"We may not have robots roaming the streets quite yet, but if the Origibot has anything to do with it, that will soon become a reality"


"the Origibot, a telepresence device that is not only functional, it’s affordable too."


What is ORIGIBOT?

ORIGIBOT is a fully robotic platform that pairs with your Android phone or tablet (running our free App) to become a complete telepresence solution.  You connect remotely to ORIGIBOT from anywhere in the world on most any device with an Internet connection (Android, iOS, Windows, Mac).  Since it uses WebRTC technology, the web interface is simple and light (doesn't require any additional plugins or java applets).  It's also fast and responsive with minimal lag over broadband connections.

Not only do you have two-way audio and video, but also full control of the robotic platform, arm, and gripper.  How awesome is that?  A full 5 degrees of freedom (including the robot base) to interact with the remote environment!

By leveraging your existing device as its communications hub, display, and camera, we were able to create something awesome at a great price.  Also, because its Android, this opens the door to unlimited applications and future enhancements from users and the community.

Here are just some things ORIGIBOT can do:



Featured in:


DESIGN:

ORIGIBOT is made mostly of sleek aluminum extrusions.  Its minimalist design is all about functionality and strength.  The body and arms are just the right length to be unobtrusive while navigating, yet can reach from a few inches off the ground to just above most counters, door knobs, and refrigerator water dispensers.

ORIGIBOT will ship with an updated tablet mount that will accommodate ANY android phone or tablet with up to a 10" display. 
(Our prototype is carrying a 7" Samsung galaxy tab 3 )

ABS plastic parts were carefully designed for 3D Printing, easy updates, and modifications.  All design files will be made available to contributors.

ORIGIBOT's gripper opens to 7.8 cm with a recess to accommodate cans, bottles, and cups.

Motorized wheels are mounted at the optimum location to provide great stability even when carrying payloads.

Standard T-Slot extrusions provide incredible strength and easy customization.



Control:

Simple controls via our secure app make controlling ORIGIBOT child's play.  Simply login from any device running Firefox or Chrome browser (supporting WebRTC) and access your ORIGIBOT.  The intuitive joystick control makes maneuvering ORIGIBOT as easy as playing an arcade game: control the base forward, backward, turn left, turn right, and stop.  Sliders control movements for the Neck, Arm, Wrist and Gripper.  Tilt the neck forward and backward to get a better view of the environment.  Lift the arm up and down, then turn the wrist to get just the right position.  Open and close the gripper to grasp or release.


Fully hackable...

ORIGIBOT was built from the ground up using off-the-shelf components including standard and high-torque hobby servos, standard T-Slot aluminum framing, and an Arduino for control.  All custom components are 3D Printed and .stl files will be available for download so you can modify and print replacements yourself.  Its Arduino sketch will also be available so you can add custom commands and tweak parameters yourself.  The ORIGIBOT forum will become a community where fellow enthusiasts can share and collaborate on ideas and enhancements.


What can ORIGIBOT do?
(What can I do with ORIGIBOT)?


Unlock a deadbolt                              Open a door


Get water from the fridge                Fill your pet's bowl


Bring Grandma her meds                    Water your plants


Retrieve the remote

Patrol your home/office

Join in on events while away

Turn on/off lights and appliances

???

    *Please note that this is an experimental robot and cannot be relied upon to provide care to any people or pets!

    What the ORIGIBOT can do is only limited by your imagination (and its hardware of course).

    Power/Battery:

    Included NiMh batteries provide about 8 hours of standby time with moderate use.  The included charger will safely recharge the batteries in under 4 hours.  Batteries do not suffer from "memory" and will recharge over 1000 cycles.

    Development/Prototyping...

    We went through countless iterations of robots - constantly tweaking the proportions to maximize stability, range of motion, and ease of maneuverability.  Our final design stands just under 1m (38") H with a base of just 32cm W x 35.5cm L (12.5" x 14").  This allows it to easily traverse even the most confined

    of spaces with the perfect reach just just over standard kitchen counters and door knobs/dead bolts.  Although it looks top heavy, you can see in the video that it is extremely stable even at full extension and payload.  This is due to a very low center of gravity and hefty mass of 3.35kg (7.4lbs) centered near the rear of the robot.

    (Special thanks to Makeblock.cc for their awesome robot construction kit!)



    We custom designed our own gripper with just the right balance of cost/size/function.  Our gripper opens wide enough to grab a cup or can of soda and has a unique curved shape to get a good grip on whatever you're carrying.


    While we made sure to source only standard components wherever possible, custom parts were designed for 3D printing.  We printed hundreds of parts while constantly testing & tweaking until we got it right.
    Thanks heavens for RepRap (and Printrbot)!


    We ended up with a robust robotic platform made entirely of strong aluminum framing and 3D printed ABS parts.

    Our Arduino firmware will be available for download so you can modify it as you wish.


    Why Indiegogo?

    Over the past year, we have made many prototypes and much progress... Now we have a working design that has been tweaked and tested.  We need your help to bring ORIGIBOT to market by bringing manufacturing costs down.  Larger quantity buys and streamlined assembly processes are only possible at the larger volumes made possible by your support!

    Can't/don't want to contribute but still think the ORIGIBOT is awesome?  Please help us by spreading the word to all your friends and family!

    Who are you people anyway?

    We are makers and doers... We are Engineers and Scientists who love technology, but not just for technology sake.  With backgrounds in Electrical and Computer Engineering, Software Development, and Product Design and Manufacturing, we are well positioned to make this project a success!

    What We Need & What You Get

    Our campaign goal is just high enough to unlock volume savings with quantities just large enough to make mass assembly feasible.  Every contribution counts and we appreciate every one!  We are offering some great perks for robot enthusiasts at EVERY level:



    Production Plan


    Risks & Challenges

    We have minimized risk by sourcing ONLY standard and 3D Printable parts. Further, we have developed several prototypes and have a fully functional, tested version as you see in the video.  We also have working software and apps.  All we need is to ramp up our order quantities and tweak and refine our UI.
