story:
The FUSAR Experience

The FUSAR experience starts with our app. Just like everything else we build, it's a fully featured product that works well as a standalone tool for riders of all types. It has been designed to provide the action sports community with a place to connect with other riders and share their experience, both the good and bad. Use it to record your rides, save your favorite routes, track your performance metrics - no matter the sport. Your photos, videos, routes and ride stats are all available right from your profile page. Share them to the FUSAR feed, or across your favorite social media channels. You can also talk to your friends at the push of a button thanks to our unlimited-range RiderChat walkie talkie feature. If you find yourself in need of help, you can use our Guardian Angel Emergency Alert feature to send a free SOS message with your GPS location and phone numbers for nearby EMS dispatchers to 3 preset emergency contacts. Did we mention the app is 100% free? Even if you're not in the market for hardware products, this is one tool you can't leave home without.

The app is where it all starts, but we take things to the next level with our line of FUSAR Hardwear™ products. Our universal smart helmet system is capable of turning ANY helmet into a smart, connected device - no matter the type, size or shape. There are a just a few components in the kit: the FUSAR Smart Action Camera, the F7 Bluetooth Headset, and our handlebar and wrist-mounted remote controls. Each product functions as a standalone device, but you can unlock some of our best features when you use them together.

The complete system provides full action camera, activity tracking, unlimited-range communication*, navigation, music playback, black box, and emergency alert capabilities. Everything the modern rider needs. You can use our handlebar or wrist-mounted remote control everything when you're on the go. No more stopping what you are doing, pulling off you gloves, and fishing your phone out of your pocket. We're not talking about "inaction sports" here. Now, you can control your favorite music, talk to your friends, drop waypoints, highlight your favorite twisties, snap and share photos and videos - all without ever taking your hands off the bars or your eyes off of what's ahead.

*requires cellular data connection

 

No one likes having to reach up to their helmet to mess with buttons they can't see. Our handlebar and wrist-mounted remote controls allow you to easily interface with your FUSAR Camera. Multi-color LEDs provide constant feedback, so you always know exactly what it's doing.

Short press on your handlebar or wrist controller to snap a hi-res photo, or long press to start recording HD video. Photos and video thumbnails instantly sync with your smartphone so you can easily view and share.

Have you ever missed an awesome shot because your action camera wasn't recording? We feel your pain. That's why we created the HotShot™ feature. Press two buttons on your handlebar or wrist controller to save the last 15 seconds of action and push it to social media in real-time - even if you weren't actively recording! By the time you stop to check your phone, your friends have already seen it, liked it, and shared it.

Our cloud-based push-to-talk communication feature enables up to 12 users to chat walkie-talkie style, over any distance. You can use the FUSAR F7 Bluetooth headset or any 3rd party Bluetooth headset that syncs to iOS and Android devices.

The onboard sensors in the FUSAR Camera allow you to track your activity like never before. Ever wanted to know what your air time was? How far you leaned in a turn? How to get back to that awesome set of twisties? Now, all of that data is right at your fingertips.

The FUSAR Camera can detect if you've experienced a collision. When a crash has been detected, it immediately sends out an emergency distress beacon. Our cloud servers then automatically send SMS and email alerts to your emergency contacts, or Guardian Angels. They receive a map with your precise location and the local phone numbers of the three nearest EMS dispatchers (over 15,000 locations in North America alone).

In the event you go down, our patented black box system locks down the last two minutes of audio, video, speed, direction of travel, and other telemetry information. For the first time ever, you'll have a full, contextual record of what happened leading up to the incident.

The FUSAR app packs a lot of punch. It is free to download for iOS and Android devices. Without any additional hardware, it allows you to track your rides, use in-app push-to-talk comms, send GPS emergency beacons, and share photos and videos.

 

FUSAR Camera

  • Sensor Type: 16MP Sony™ CMOS
  • Lens Rotation: 180 degrees
  • Field-of-View: 160 degrees
  • Still Photos While Filming: 2MP
  • Video Modes at Release: 720p30, 1080p30
  • Video Modes after 1st Update: 720p30, 1080p30, 1080p60
  • Memory: microSD & microSDHD memory cards up to 64GB
  • 3-axis accelerometer
  • 3-axis gyroscope
  • 3-axis magnetometer
  • Wired Connectivity: USB Type-C connector
  • Wireless Connectivity: Wi-Fi/Bluetooth 4.0
  • Positioning: GPS/GLONASS
  • Battery Capacity: 2400mAh
  • Battery Life: 2-4 hours (depending on what features are in use)
  • Charge Time: 2.5 hours
  • Can be charged while in use
  • Waterproof

Handlebar/Wrist Remote Control Units

  • Bluetooth 4.0
  • 3 Buttons control 9 functions
  • Control music playback
  • Control FUSAR's unlimited-range Push-To-Talk capabilities
  • Photo/video capture at your finger tips
  • Battery type: CR2032 Coin Cell
  • Battery life: up to 6 months w/ frequent use
  • Waterproof
  • Quick-release hook-and-loop straps
  • Flexible steel chassis allows it to work with a wide range of handlebar sizes

F7 Bluetooth Headset

  • Bluetooth 3.0
  • FM radio
  • DSP noise cancellation
  • Stream music or GPS audio from your phone
  • Pairs with most popular GPS navigators
  • Rider-to-Rider range: ~50 feet/15 meters
  • Battery type: Lithium polymer
  • Battery life: ~10 hours
  • Charge time: ~2.5 hours
  • Connector type: micro-USB

 

We're action sports nuts and tech junkies. Hooligan nerds. We're putting decades of action sports experience into the creation of products that meet our own strict standards. Our team is comprised of experienced product developers and engineers who have shipped products for globally renowned brands. We are passionate to a fault and we own it. We ride, design, build and code everything.

Ryan Shearman - Founder & CEO
Ryan is a seasoned engineer and product developer, having brought over 100 high-end consumer goods to market. He's also a huge adrenaline junky and a life-long action sports enthusiast, with over 20 years' experience riding motorcycles and snowboarding. He enjoys long walks on the beach and jumping out of airplanes.

 

 Todd Hunter Rushing - Co-founder, Chief Designer
Todd is an industrial designer by profession and a gear head to the core. He was the youngest designer ever hired to work for LG Electronics' North American design team, where he worked on everything from laptops and smartphones to washing machines and vacuum cleaners.

 

 Clayton Patton - Co-founder, CFO
A startup veteran, Clayton was employee #4 at SFX Entertainment. He left to join FUSAR after the company's successful IPO on the NASDAQ (SFXE). He's an avid cyclist who participates in century rides to raise money and awareness for Autism research. He's also the proud owner of Triumph America.

 

 Dr. Geraud Krawezik - Lead Software Engineer
Geraud leads our software team. He studied embedded systems before earning a PhD in super computing. He and his team design and implement the software that powers our entire product ecosystem.

 

 Mike Yagudayev - Electrical Engineer
Mike came to FUSAR from MakerBot, where he led the development of the user interface board in their 5th gen 3D printer. When he's not busy designing and soldering circuit boards, he's either out on his Yamaha or playing a classic Zelda game. Oh, and his voice impersonations are on point.

 

 Jordan De Liso - Mechanical Design Engineer
Jordan is a Tufts-educated mechanical engineer who received his 1st patent while still in high school. He has been on 2-wheels since NES's Excitebike came out, and currently rides a 2013 Honda CBR500R.

 

 Robert Oliveira - Software Engineer
Robert is a huge software geek that specializes in back-end functionality. He's the keeper in between the client and server, and deploys solutions for the company's API. He's also a recently licensed motorcyclist and is on the market for his first bike.

 

 

We've built multiple generations of prototypes, visited factories in China, locked down our supply chain, and now we're ready to ramp up for production and bring our universal smart helmet system to market. Our F7 Bluetooth Headset and Handlebar Remote Control are both currently shipping. The FUSAR Camera is going into production and will be delivered in mid-2017. The wrist remote control will be going into production later this year.

 

We've been working extremely hard for a year and a half on the development of our smart helmet technology. At present, we have a well defined manufacturing timeline and are confident with our ability to deliver on time. As with any consumer product, we may encounter some unexpected bumps along the way. That's why we've partnered with the world renowned manufacturing experts at   to bring our universal smart helmet system to market. Together, we've worked hard to plan for the unexpected and mitigate any risks.

We need to produce the tooling necessary to manufacture different components. This is a lengthy and expensive process, and complications could delay our delivery timeline. Fortunately, we've chosen partners that we can work very closely with throughout the entire process.

We're creating software that lives in the cloud, on your smartphone, and in our devices. All of our features are currently functional, but we're in the process of testing and refining them to ensure the best experience for our customers. This is a complex process, but our software developers have expertise in this area and we are working closely with our development partners to ensure that all bugs are squashed in a timely fashion.

We've built a team of seasoned product developers that are equipped to overcome any challenges that may arise. We're also enthusiasts, so we set the bar pretty high for ourselves. Our mission is to deliver kickass products to you in a timely fashion. Come ride with us.

 

1. Will the FUSAR Camera work with my helmet?

Yes! The FUSAR Camera has been designed to work with helmets of all different shapes and sizes. You can mount it to the top or the sides of your favorite lid. We've been doing this for a year and a half and have yet to find one that doesn't work.

2. Can I use my own Bluetooth headset?

Absolutely. The FUSAR Handlebar Remote Control, Camera, and app are all compatible with any 3rd party Bluetooth headset that is able to sync with Android or iOS devices.

3. Can I use the FUSAR Camera in the rain?

Definitely. The camera, handlebar remote and wrist remote are designed to be suitable for use in any weather, even torrential downpours. 

4. How much is the FUSAR app?

Free. Who pays for apps these days? Seriously, it's 2017. The FUSAR app is available for download in the Apple App Store and the Google Play Store.

5. Can the FUSAR Camera pair with more than one phone at the same time?

No, it can only pair to one phone at a time, but you can chat with your friends and share content through the FUSAR app.

6. How does the push-to-talk feature work over any distance?

Your voice travels through the cloud instead of transmitting peer-to-peer. As long as you have a data connection, you're good to go. We've used it over thousands of miles with no added latency!

7. How long does the FUSAR Camera's battery last?

The camera as a 2300mAh battery that provides 2-4 hours of use on a single charge (depending on what features are in use). You can also charge the device while in use, extending battery life. Please note there are a number of conditions that can drastically affect run times, including use in cold weather and continuous use of Wi-Fi.

8. How long does it take to charge the FUSAR Camera?

Your camera's battery will go from fully drained to fully charged in about 2.5 hours.

9. How many Guardian Angels can I have?

You can add up to 3 Guardian Angels to your emergency contact list. They will receive SMS and email alerts in the event you experience a collision.

10. When will you start shipping?

The FUSAR Handlebar Remote Control and F7 Bluetooth headset are both currently shipping! The FUSAR Camera and wrist controller are expected to ship in Q2 2017.

11. Will you ship to my country?

Worldwide shipping is available. Any import duties, taxes or brokerage fees due at the time of delivery are the sole responsibility of the receiving customer. Packing slips for International Shipments cannot be marked as a "gift" or with altered prices.

12. What's the warranty?

There is a 12 month warranty against all defects.

13. How can I upgrade or change my perk level?

Please follow these instuctions from Indiegogo:

https://support.indiegogo.com/...

14. What is your return policy?

Orders can be canceled up until they are shipped. Once an item ships, it cannot be returned/refunded.

15. Where can I learn more?

Please direct all inquiries to support@fusar.com

story:
Welcome to The Carry-On Closet 2.0. Luggage that fits your on-the-go lifestyle and keeps you organized on the road. Available in 2 sizes and 3 colors, this is the upgraded version of our suitcase that keeps selling out. 

 

The shelf hangs on the handle of the suitcase and the front door acts as a kickstand - so you're fully self sufficient no matter how your hotel or Airbnb ends up being. 

 

Why is it 2.0? It’s improved from the original that we keep selling out of! We launched the 1.0 last winter and we've sold out of it 5 times. On top of that, TIME Magazine listed us as Best Inventions 2018 in the travel category!

 

The Carry-On fits as standard carry-on for all airlines, including European airlines with limited sizing. The Carry-On Plus is geared for American travelers - U.S. Domestic flights allow this size. Most flights will allow you to take either suitcase + a personal item (i.e. a backpack) *note: we've tested on 20+ flights with the Carry-On Plus size and never been denied.

How we've traveled with these:

Carry-On: 7x T-Shirts, 7x Socks, 7x Undies, 1 sweater, 1 pair of jeans, Swimsuit.

Carry-On Plus: 9x t-shirts, 10x socks, 10x Undies, 2 sweaters, 1 jeans, 1 jacket, Swimsuit.

Weight of Carry-On: 7.6lbs + Weight of Carry-On Plus: 7.9lbs. The shelf adds 0.5lbs)

1) Open the suitcase. 2) Grab shelf system by the top strap and lift up vertically. 3) Hang the shelf from the suitcase trolley handle using the top strap or using the pocket on the back of the shelf. 4) Grab your outfit and go!  

This is a major upgrade to the 2.0 - we've made it a great suitcase regardless of the shelf. This means improved internal organization - allows for way better organization in case you're on a trip where you don't use the shelf. *We use the shelf on 3/4 of trips.

 

BYOPB - The internal pocket has space for any powerbank - allowing you to keep charged on the journey. The USB Port has a waterproof flap that covers when not in use. 

 

 

 Anti-Theft is at our core - included is a TSA Approved lock. 

 

 

Our polycarbonate shell has an anti-scratch surface and offers a little bit of flex for the perfect balance of being durable for long haul (in case you want to check it), and light weight for carrying up the stairs to your Airbnb.

 

 

We love travel and we love the planet. Everything we build is designed with sustainability in mind. Starting now - we also remove 5lbs of plastic from the ocean for each item we sell.

We owe all of our success to our Kickstarter community and we will forever be thankful for you. You've got first dibs to get discounted products - and the first units to ship. First time backing a Kickstarter? Check over this quick demo to learn how it works. 

Our team is truly global. We’re based all over the world and we strive every day to be the best that we can be.

Adrian Solgaard: Founder and CEO | Chris Cavill: Head of Design | Stan Liu: Head of Operations | Kaveh Kiani: International Sales | Estefania Leon: Controller of Chaos| Libby Vilner: Social Media Coordinator | Taylor King: Photo & Video | Jenina Julian: Customer Service 

About us:

We believe that being a global citizen is about being a good steward to the earth while enjoying everything that it has to offer. Our goal is to undo the damage humans have caused to the planet, beginning with ocean plastics. That’s why everything we make is created with a belief in building sustainability for tomorrow. We strive to give more back to the planet than we take.

We’re obsessed with solving problems for our fellow global citizens. We create smart and sustainable everyday items at the intersection of fashion and technology. We make awesome products that are available to you at a price that’s reasonable, because we believe you should spend your money on experiences, not things.

More information about Solgaard and our Sustainable practices can be found at www.Solgaard.co

story:
Unplug. Relax & Have Fun!

It’s time to levitate your life. We are offering you a comfortable and dynamic way to experience and connect with the world around you. 

 

 

Feel like you’re flying on the aerial mat and create out of this world experiences everywhere you go. We take you to a new level, mind and body. Levitat is here to empower you to live, take a break, relax, have fun and feel free!

 

 

Taking Levitat with you is easy and comfortable. With our compact backpack the aerial mat is lighter and smaller than two water bottles.

Spend less than three minutes creating your own personal oasis! The aerial mat can be set up anywhere and everywhere, outdoor and indoor (with the Levi-stand).

 

 

All you need is three points (trees, poles, or columns) and you will be able to mount the aerial mat. No need for the points to be equal distance apart, adjust the tension and height and you’re ready to go!

Check out all the versatile ways you can enjoy our aerial mat.

 

· Relax: Rest, chill and even sleep like a baby. 

· Play: Adored by children of all ages.

· Trekking: Take a break and relax with the best views.

· Cross-training: Improve your core strength and balance.

· Yoga: The perfect complement to any yoga practice.

· Meditation: Take your mindfulness to a higher level with absolute peace and comfort. 

· Much more: Whatever your imagination comes up! Only you set the limits!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

   

 

 

  

 

 

 The Standard Aerial Mat comes with the "Chartreuse" color. (Between green and yellow)

The Aerial Mat also comes with other unique options.

The Limited Edition Color pledge.

· Beige color

· Blue color straps

· Purple color

 

  

 

 

 

 

 Our Design Team with wide experience and several International Design Awards have developed together with our engineers the Aerial Mat. They have taken care of every detail to optimize the size, weight and durability. 

 

 

 

Looking to buy Levitat add-on items? Send us an email:
 info@levitatfly.com

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

CUSTOMS & DUTIES INFORMATION  

We cannot mark your packages as gift--this is illegal, so we will not be able to do this. Our prices do not include your country's VAT, GST or other unique country taxes.  

As many of you know, our terms of sale for international orders are FOB Destination. This means that you pay duties or taxes in your country. As we are shipping these products all over the world, it is impossible for us to build in the various duties, VAT and GST tax for each location through IndieGoGo. 

We found this handy tool, that can assist you in calculating duties. Remember to convert the U.S. dollars to your local currency: 

http://www.dutycalculator.com/new-import-duty-a... 

As many of you know, Canadian Customs are strict on products imported into Canada. All products over Canadian $25 are subject to duties and GST or VAT tax. 

Here's a link to find the CBSA offices where you can actually go and do the clearance, and save a significant amount of money: 

http://www.cbsa-asfc.gc.ca/do-rb/services/lvs-e...

story:
한국어 | Español | 中文(简体)

 

Stay connected on the go! Ahead simply snaps onto any helmet and connects to your smartphone via Bluetooth. Listen to your favorite tunes, make phone calls and never get lost again, all whilst being safe and wireless with Ahead's non-evasive solution.

AHEAD is the first product of its kind to keep you connected in an age where staying in touch is becoming more and more important. Unlike ordinary Bluetooth Headsets with speakers, AHEAD uses an oscillator to transmit sound through vibrations, creating a safer, hands-free and non-invasive solution. Clearly communicate with friends, use your navigation or chill out to your favorite Drake track, all whilst staying safe, alert and wireless.

AHEAD uses an oscillator to transmit sound through vibrations. This allows you to clearly hear your favorite tunes, chat to friends and use voice-activated commands via your smartphone. As AHEAD is an external device, it does not block out the noise of your surroundings unlike other devices, which completely cancels out any outside noise. This makes AHEAD a safer option when riding your beloved Vintage Vespa or cruising around town. 


There is nothing worse than making a phone call and battling to be heard over the background noise. Using our specially designed BEAMFORMING Technology, we are able to eliminate nearly all ambient and wind noises to up to 60km/h (40mph), making it perfect to use in any setting, indoor or out. Using two specially designed narrow-angle microphones strategically placed to capture sound from just in front of your mouth, AHEAD works to make every conversation as clear as possible.

 

Helmets generally mean you are performing a somewhat dangerous activity and safety should always be paramount. Free yourself from the constraints of wires, arrive alive and stay connected with AHEAD's game changing technology.

AHEAD transmits sounds via vibrations, allowing you to listen to your favorite tunes whilst on the go. Unlike other devices, AHEAD does not block out surrounding noise, allowing you to stay alert and aware. Arrive Alive with AHEAD.

Planning to carve up the slopes this weekend with your friends? Stay in constant communication with your entire party with AHEADS Multi-Party Call Function. Leave no man/woman behind ever again!

Answer phone calls with ease with AHEADS Click-To-Talk Function. Simply click the device to answer your incoming calls so you can keep your hands free. No more fumbling in your pockets for your phone.

Integrate AHEAD with your Intelligent Assistant App on your smartphone, and make voice-commands directly. Whether you are using Siri or Bixby, AHEAD accommodates them all!

Attach your AHEAD Unit to any flat surface using our ‘Flat Mount’ and AHEAD doubles as your own personal speaker. Listen to music whilst at home or in the office, making AHEAD your everyday, all day companion.

 

 

AHEAD is compatible with all helmet types. With two different types of helmet mounts, as well as a specially designed flat mount, you can turn any flat surface in your home or office into a speaker good enough for your next party.

Designed for helmets with lots of venting and curves, such as bicycle helmets.

Designed for solid surfaces and helmets, such as motorcycle and snowboard helmets.

Turn any flat surface in your home or office into your personal speaker.

 

AHEAD is created to be used on the go, therefore we’ve put it through rigorous testing to make sure it is Super Duper Durable! In addition to being as tough as nails, AHEAD is also waterproof, making it the perfect companion - rain, hail or shine.

 

AHEAD’s free mobile APP helps you maximize the benefits of your device. The FREE App allows AHEAD users to customize buttons, enable push-to-talk, as well as fine-tune and tweak a number of settings to your personal preference. The app is available for download for iOS and Android users.

 

We took AHEAD on a worldwide field test.
Here’s what they had to say!

 
 
 
 

The original inspiration for the development of AHEAD was to allow construction workers to be able to effectively, safely and seamlessly communicate on job sites. Snapping ‘AHEAD’ onto any hard hat allows workers to keep in touch through a push-to- talk application, similar to the ones already used on many job sites. Being waterproof and durable up to IP45 Standards allows Ahead to withstand any damage that may occur in a workplace setting.

AHEAD can also be used for professional athletes to stay in constant communication with coaches and teammates during practice. Athletes simply snap their AHEAD onto their helmets. The durability will allow the device to absorb any physical impacts during the session.

 

 

In 2015, the team at AHEAD was awarded a spot in ‘Samsung’s C-Lab Accelerator,’ with the concept to develop and market a communication device that could attach onto any helmet and provide a safer alternative to stay connected whilst on the go. Since then, we have worked tirelessly to perfect and create a design, that is not only aesthetically beautiful, but functional too.

 

On a skiing trip with friends, our Founder and CEO, Marco, had his light bulb moment, which gave him the concept and idea for AHEAD. Finding difficult staying in touch with friends, through the thick layers of clothing and protective gear while carving up the slopes, Marco saw a gap in the market, where this simple, yet powerful device can change the way people move and stay connected, not only on the slopes, but any activity involving protective gear.

The use of a smartphone while riding on  bicycle is dangerous, yet wearing earphones and headphones can be cumbersome.  Noise cancelling technology make it impossible to stay alert to surroundings.

Marco and his team decided to get straight to work on designing a device which will change the lives of not only extreme sport enthusiasts, but through to everyday commuters and construction workers alike.

In 2015, AHEAD was awarded a spot in Samsung’s Coveted C-Lab Acceleration Program. This gave the team the boost and financial freedom needed to boost our R&D efforts in hardware manufacturing.

Samsung gave us the legs we needed to start walking, with their seed funding, and AHEAD may have never existed as it is today without it. Now, we are a fully independent company, with ownership rights to all of our IP and our staff members now work for Analogue Plus.

 

 

 

Press Kit  

 If you are a member of the press and need more resources, please download our press kit or reach us at contact@analogue-plus.com

Images & Video Downloads  

 Please feel free to share about us on social media. You can download more product images and videos from the links below.  

Indiegogo Video

High resolution photos of Ahead

 

Risks and challenges

As with any project, tech based or other, there are a range of risks and other factors, which can affect and inhibit the timeline of a project. We have taking the necessary factors in order to mitigate those risks. 

We have done everything we can, and put in place procedures and steps in order to ensure we can meet our mass production start date of July, for delivery of your AHEAD Units by October! 

Here’s what we’ve done, and how you can be sure:

•    Our prototypes are now fully functional and ready for market. We have been carrying out global field-testing since early 2017, with great feedback and results.
•    We’ve sourced and partnered up with a manufacturer in which we trust and can execute. We have crossed the T’s and dotted the I’s on all things legal and our contract is set in place for our first run! 
•    In 2015, we were accelerated by Samsung’s C-Lab Accelerator program, which has granted us access to resources and industry expertise most other startups lack. Through this partnership, we have been able to source a reputable manufacturer to work with. 

These steps, along with the countless man-hours put in by the team, ensure we have put ourselves in a great position to mitigate and eliminate all risks and unexpected events. Fun and exciting times AHEAD!

story: I am hoping to raise over £3000 for my expedition in 2016 to Costa Rica/ Nicaragua. It is a 4 week expedition which includes hiking, culture enrichment and helping out the locals in the community. Whilst I realise that I cannot raise £3000 through online donations alone, every little helps and so any donation will be gratefully received!

story:
Clicca qui per la versione italiana

FUND THE 12th OCTOBER BONFIRE!

CLICK HERE FOR FACEBOOK EVENT

Fire as a tool for catharsis.
Fire to burn down our monsters.
Fire when the season change.

Keeping true to our italian tradition of burning down an "old hag" made of wood to celebrate the new year and the incoming spring, we decided to build a magnificient bonfire every six months, and to make in meaningful, we let people throw their "monsters" in it. A "monster" can be something meaningful (like a diary or a cloth) or a wooden plank with something written on it. In the last edition a guy wanted to throw a full drumset, but we stopped him and he threw only a tom so we could donate the drumset to another guy!

We did the first bonfire in March 2013, and now we are going to make it again on the 12th of October 2013, always in Cerro al Lambro (Milan, Italy). The edition of March was funded only with donations during the bonfire, and for this edition, we have decided to try internet sorcery with crowdfunding!

Please note that ALL the photos on this site refer to the last edition, but as soon as the organization starts, we'll keep you informed with the work in progress!

We are going to give full information about the time and the location here and on our facebook page, so saty tuned!

Now, here are two really important things you have to know before choosing to fund or not.

  1. THE ENTIRE THING IS NON-PROFIT. All the money raised will be used to pay the costs of the bonfire, the fee of the paramedics and firefighters presidiating the event and the coreographic stuff like stands and fuel for the fire jugglers. The exceeding money will be used to make a donation to the Protezione Civile (the italian emergency management agency). Last edition's total costs where nearly 600 € and we rised like 240 € with donations on site, so we pretty much paid the event from our pockets (AND we did a donation to the Protezione Civile). The budget will documented and public just like in the last edition and so will be an eventual receipt for the donation. Onsite we won't sell anything and we'll just accept donations (people will bring their own beers). It must be very clear that for us is all about the bonfire and the community, and our goal is just not losing (too much) money.
  2. THE EVENT IS PUBLIC AND LEGAL. We have full authorization from the owner of the field and from local authorities. We'll have an ambulance on site for emergencies and a squad of the Protezione Civile with a water cistern for security. We'll answer any information by mail. The March edition went really really well, everything was great, and even the mayor of Cerro al Lambro was present and really realy happy!

What's going to happen?

It's up to you! We'll bring fire dancers and dragons... Drumming will fill the air... Your heart will pound and your feet will dance..."che te lo dico a fare?" Join us!

You will bring us your monsters, and when the bonfire will finally collapse to the ground, we'll let you cross the safety line and throw them in the embers as the crowd will help your screaming while you give your demons to the flames!

"Dissolving our monsters"

---

info +39-340-051293

Via Mirandola
C/O Cascina Gazzera
Cerro al Lambro, Milan
Italy

map: http://binged.it/14E3k3P
car park: http://goo.gl/maps/9K1qx

FINANZIA IL FALO' DEL 12 OTTOBRE!

CLICCA QUI PER L'EVENTO SU FACEBOOK

Fuoco come trumento di catarsi
Fuoco che brucia i nostri mostri
Fuoco quando la stagione cambia

In linea con la tradizione di bruciare "la vecchia" di legna per celebrare l'anno nuovo che inizia e la primavera che scaccia l'inverno, abbiamo deciso di costruire un bel falò ogni sei mesi, e per rendere il tutto significativo, facciamo in modo che la gente ci getti dentro i propri "mostri". Un "mostro" può essere qualcosa con un significato (come un diario oppure un vestito) oppure una tavoletta di legno con sopra scritto qualcosa. Nell'ultima edizione un ragazzo voleva gettare nel fuoco un'intera batteria, ma lo abbiamo fermato in tempo e abbiamo gettato solo un tom, regalandola a un altro tizio che ne aveva bisogno!

Abbiamo cominciato con il primo falò nel Marzo 2013, e adesso abbiamo intenzione di ripetere l'evento il 12 Ottobre 2013, sempre a Cerro al Lambro (provincia sud di Milano). L'edizione di Marzo è stata finanziata unicamente da donazioni raccolte durante il falò, ma questo giro abbiamo voluto provare l'esperienza del crowdfunding!

Quando i lavori saranno a buon punto, daremo piene informazioni sulla location e sugli orari qui e sulla nostra pagina facebook. Stay tuned!

Nota: tutte le foto attualmente sul sito sono state scattate durante l'edizione passata. Con l'andare del tempo aggiorneremo la pagina coi lavori in corso, indicando i progressi per l'edizione corrente!

Ora, ci sono due cose importanti che dovresti tenere in considerazione prima di decidere se donare oppure no.

  1. L'EVENTO E' INTERAMENTE NON-PROFIT. Tutti i soldi raccolti servono per coprire le spese del falò, il conto della croce rossa e della protezione civile per averli presenti sul posto e le coreografie come i banchetti e il gasolio per i giocolieri. Eventuali soldi eccedenti verrano donati interamente alla Protezione Civile e tutto sarà documentato pubblicamente. L'ultima edizione ci è costata circa 600 €, e con le donazioni ne abbiamo raccolti circa 240, quindi di fatto abbiamo messo fuori i soldi di tasca nostra (E COMUNQUE abbiamo fatto una donazione alla protezione civile. Inoltre, la sera non viene venduto nulla: tutti i cibi e le bevande vanno portati da casa. Vorremmo quindi che sia chiaro che non guadagneremo nulla e a noi interessa solo poter fare il falò senza perderci (troppo).
  2. L'EVENTO E' PUBBLICO E LEGALE. Abbiamo la piena autorizzazione del proprietario del campo e delle autorità locali. La sera saranno presenti un'ambulanza e la Protezione Civile con una cisterna d'acqua per garantire la sicurezza. A chiunque volesse possiamo dare i dettagli via mail. Nell'edizione di Marzo è andato tutto alla grande, era presente il sindaco di Cerro al Lambro e anche lui si è detto estremamente contento per la cosa!

Ma qual'è il programma?

Dipende da te! Noi porteremo il fuoco e i draghi... Si sentirà nell'aria il suono delle percussioni e il tuo cuore batterà e i tuoi piedi danzeranno... "che te lo dico a fare?" Essici!!!

Tu ci porterai i tuoi mostri, e quando la pira collasserà finalmente al suolo, ti lasceremo passare le linee di sicurezza e potrai lanciarli sulle braci e la folla ti aiuterà con le grida mentre tu dai i tuoi demoni alle fiamme!

"Dissolvendo i nostri mostri"

Per informazioni chiamare il 340-051293

Via Mirandola
C/O Cascina Gazzera
Cerro al Lambro (MI)

mappa: http://binged.it/14E3k3P
parcheggio: http://goo.gl/maps/9K1qx

It's up to you! We'll bring fire dancers and dragons... Drumming will fill the air... Your 
heart will pound and your feet will dance..."che te lo dico a fare?" Join us!
You will bring us your monsters, and when the bonfire will finally collapse to the ground, we'll let you cross the safety line and throw them in the embers as the crowd will help your screaming while you give your demons to the flames!

"Dissolving our monsters"---
info +39-340-051293Via MirandolaC/O Cascina GazzeraCerro al Lambro, MilanItalymap: http://binged.it/14E3k3Pcar park: http://goo.gl/maps/9K1qx

FINANZIA IL FALO' DEL 12 OTTOBRE!
CLICCA QUI PER L'EVENTO SU FACEBOOK
Fuoco come trumento di catarsiFuoco che brucia i nostri mostriFuoco quando la stagione cambia

In linea con la tradizione di bruciare "la vecchia" di legna per celebrare l'anno nuovo che inizia e la primavera che scaccia l'inverno, abbiamo deciso di costruire un bel falò ogni sei mesi, e per rendere il tutto significativo, facciamo in modo che la gente ci getti dentro i propri "mostri". Un "mostro" può essere qualcosa con un significato (come un diario oppure un vestito) oppure una tavoletta di legno con sopra scritto qualcosa. Nell'ultima edizione un ragazzo voleva gettare nel fuoco un'intera batteria, ma lo abbiamo fermato in tempo e abbiamo gettato solo un tom, regalandola a un altro tizio che ne aveva bisogno!
Abbiamo cominciato con il primo falò nel Marzo 2013, e adesso abbiamo intenzione di ripetere l'evento il 12 Ottobre 2013, sempre a Cerro al Lambro (provincia sud di Milano). L'edizione di Marzo è stata finanziata unicamente da donazioni raccolte durante il falò, ma questo giro abbiamo voluto provare l'esperienza del crowdfunding!
Quando i lavori saranno a buon punto, daremo piene informazioni sulla location e sugli orari qui e sulla nostra pagina facebook. Stay tuned!
Nota: tutte le foto attualmente sul sito sono state scattate durante l'edizione passata. Con l'andare del tempo aggiorneremo la pagina coi lavori in corso, indicando i progressi per l'edizione corrente!Ora, ci sono due cose importanti che dovresti tenere in considerazione prima di decidere se donare oppure no.


L'EVENTO E' INTERAMENTE NON-PROFIT. Tutti i soldi raccolti servono per coprire le spese del falò, il conto della croce rossa e della protezione civile per averli presenti sul posto e le coreografie come i banchetti e il gasolio per i giocolieri. Eventuali soldi eccedenti verrano donati interamente alla Protezione Civile e tutto sarà documentato pubblicamente. L'ultima edizione ci è costata circa 600 €, e con le donazioni ne abbiamo raccolti circa 240, quindi di fatto abbiamo messo fuori i soldi di tasca nostra (E COMUNQUE abbiamo fatto una donazione alla protezione civile. Inoltre, la sera non viene venduto nulla: tutti i cibi e le bevande vanno portati da casa. Vorremmo quindi che sia chiaro che non guadagneremo nulla e a noi interessa solo poter fare il falò senza perderci (troppo).


L'EVENTO E' PUBBLICO E LEGALE. Abbiamo la piena autorizzazione del proprietario del campo e delle autorità locali. La sera saranno presenti un'ambulanza e la Protezione Civile con una cisterna d'acqua per garantire la sicurezza. A chiunque volesse possiamo dare i dettagli via mail. Nell'edizione di Marzo è andato tutto alla grande, era presente il sindaco di Cerro al Lambro e anche lui si è detto estremamente contento per la cosa!


Ma qual'è il programma?

Dipende da te! Noi porteremo il fuoco e i draghi... Si sentirà nell'aria il suono delle percussioni e il tuo cuore batterà e i tuoi piedi danzeranno... "che te lo dico a fare?" Essici!!!
Tu ci porterai i tuoi mostri, e quando la pira collasserà finalmente al suolo, ti lasceremo passare le linee di sicurezza e potrai lanciarli sulle braci e la folla ti aiuterà con le grida mentre tu dai i tuoi demoni alle fiamme!

"Dissolvendo i nostri mostri"Per informazioni chiamare il 340-051293Via MirandolaC/O Cascina GazzeraCerro al Lambro (MI)mappa: http://binged.it/14E3k3Pparcheggio: http://goo.gl/maps/9K1qx

story:
Hi, we are a small group of people out to “squish” a large problem – The 2 Liter Squish!

    The Story:

    Once upon a time, there was a very nice man who was invited to his good friend’s pot luck dinner and while holding a plate of food in one hand, attempted to pour himself a cup of soda from a two liter bottle with the other. Said man then embarrassed himself terribly when the dreaded “2 Liter Bottle Squish” was initiated and a geyser was produced - soda went everywhere but in the cup. Basking in the attention, he apologized and cleaned up the mess as he mused that there must be a better way - but after doing some research found out there wasn’t.

     He then remembered the old “wrap the hand evenly around the egg, squeeze the egg and it doesn’t break trick” involving Pascal’s Law combined with the rule of Circumferential Stress stating that an object is weakest when pressure is applied on part of its area and strongest when pressure is evenly distributed over its entire area (okay, whatever)! Born then, was the 2 Liter Handle. Everyone lived happily ever after!

    How It Works:

    2 Liter Handle’s unique patent pending design simply distributes your grasping force evenly around the bottle for a sure-handed, single-handed, safe, secure, pour every time. The 2 Liter Handle is light weight, dishwasher safe and is easy to use; slip it over the bottle, grab it and pour! And when you set the bottle down, 2 Liter Handle is easy to remove and place on the next bottle - with one hand! So whether you’re carrying a big plate of food at a picnic, or a small toddler at a birthday party, the 2 Liter Handle lets you pour that soda safely without having to put down your precious cargo.

    The Plan:

    The design, development, and production of the 2 Liter Handle have been completed and limited inventory has been acquired. We are looking forward to our planned retail launch of the 2 Liter Handle in mid to late February 2013. Your contributions will be used to help fund the marketing cost of the retail launch and the procurement of additional inventory to support the effort.

    We plan to use TV (infomercial) as our main media source to bring the 2 Liter Handle to the attention of the public and are near completion of a one minute commercial to be aired. Once we have established the 2 Liter Handle’s presence in the public eye, we feel certain that the exposure will help us considerably in getting the attention of the larger retail outlets, as well as generate the funds to acquire inventory necessary to approach those large retail outlets. Yes, we intend to head straight to the "As Seen On TV!" section of major retailers everywhere! Once we have been established in the retail arena and in the public eye, we anticipate the 2 Liter Handle to establish longevity by becoming a "household" item in every home where two liter bottles are used!

    We have been able to introduce the 2 Liter Handle to the retail market on a small scale and it has been received by the consumer with extreme favor.

    You would be hard pressed to walk into a single Mom & Pop store, gas station store, large grocery chain, or any other store selling food items, snacks, etc, and not find two liter bottles of soda offered for sale. Statistically, there are well over 6 billion two liter bottles sold in the United States each year – and pretty much every one of them suffers from the “2 Liter Squish!”

    We do not have statistics on how many two liter geysers are initiated at birthday, New Year’s, Superbowl parties and picnics around the world, but can imagine it is quite a few – we are out to cure that rather inconvenient and embarrassing phenomenon!

    We thank you so much for your support in this endeavor through your contributions!

    Additionally, you can help by telling your friends about the “Solution to the Squishy 2 Liter Bottle”. (Perhaps guarding them against the dreaded "2 Liter Squish" initiated geyser and sparing them from a rather embarrassing moment - Hey, what are friends for!)

    Thank you very much for your interest in assisting us!

story:
DESKA Board

The world's first city surf

A high tech board with no limits

About the Project: 

"I looked around and could not find the board I dreamed of on the market. So I decided to build it myself. I made DESKA for those who love extreme sports, It's for windsurfers, kiteboarders, snowboarders and more. It's more than a skateboard -it's an experience you have never had before. It's DESKA..."

NOW YOU CAN GET YOUR BOARD and more premium DESKA products 40% CHEAPER THAN THE NORMAL RESALE PRICE! Choose from the PERKS on the right! >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

DESKA Board won the "People's Choice" award on LaunchBox's pre-crowdfunding contest. It was a contest sponsored by HP, Intel, and Cut & Paste.

Three-times windsurfing World Champion Ricardo Campello also posted the project on his Facebook page! >


Special features:

  1. Disk brake system       
  2. Windsurf straps             
  3. Windsurf sail input       
  4. Convex carbon kevlar shape
  5. Handmade high-performance design

DISK BRAKE SYSTEM

One of the most helpful features when you use the board in the city. Just stop any time you want! You can use the board with or without the brake system! You can remove it in just two minutes.


Windsurf strap system:

You can set the straps to right-footed or left-footed positions if you're cruising in the city without a sail. Set it on the middle when you use it as a windsurf.  You can also remove it if you want to use the board without straps. Use it however you like!

The strap system makes your jumps easier and safer in the city
It's also helpful for emergency braking!

USE YOUR SAIL WITH THE BOARD!

The board can be equipped with a windsurf sail. The sail input is similar to windsurf boards. Just attach your sail to the board in 10 seconds!

GREAT FOR WINDSURF SCHOOLS!
Teach the basics of windsurfing on land! It's easy to understand the main movements and successions on the ground, and enjoy the power of wind.



Design details

& prototyping:

All parts are hand-made to the highest industry standards.


Made of Carbon and Kevlar


 

A chance to win a FREE board? YES!

SHARE THE CAMPAIGN WITH YOUR FRIENDS AND YOU CAN GET A BOARD FOR FREE!  Refer some friends, and if they pre-order, we'll send you some free DESKA products! See what you can get: 

If the project reaches more than $30,000 the boards will be available with the following graphic design on the bottom: 



Building this project was an amazing experience, and I'm very proud that it's become a reality.

Now, there's nothing left to do but get your own board, and ENJOY THE RIDE!
Thanks for visiting my campaign.

"Don't be too hard on yourself, be nice to one another and enjoy every moment in life!"  Andrew Paskowski


Cheers,

How to help?

NOW YOU CAN GET YOUR BOARD and more premium DESKA products 40% CHEAPER THAN THE NORMAL RESALE PRICE! Choose from the PERKS on the right! >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

+Team member t-shirt

+ Your name will be displayed in the credits,

Be fast! This special price is just for the first 88 boards! (40% cheaper than the resale price).+Add shipping cost in EU with DHL: $42 includes shipment tracking, Shipping outside of EU with DHL: $64 includes shipment tracking. Shipping to US: $90 includes shipment tracking.

story:
As seen on...

Mother Nature Network - "a fascinating series of photo books that highlight the vibrant colors and textures of these mysterious aquatic worlds."

Tree Hugger - "The book is the third in a trilogy that explores the sea life of the Pacific Ocean, and is focused on waters along the coasts of Canada and Alaska."

Outdoor Photography Magazine - "50% of profits will be donated to the Ocean Foundation to support, strengthen and promote organizations that are dedicated to conserving ocean environments around the world."

The Optimist - "Because of the need for rejuvenation and an audible voice to speak for the best interest of the world’s marine life, Salas is donating 50% of the proceeds from Luminous Sea to the Ocean Foundation, an organization that uses 89% of all donations towards protecting oceans and marine life."

TakePart - "California-based photographer Richard Salas wants to give everyone the next best thing with a breathtaking series of photographs that capture life under the sea."

SLR Lounge - "he’s doing so by publishing a series of books to help foster that connection between human and sea life in an effort to help save it."

And also check out Richard's guest blog for The Ocean Foundation!

LIKE Sea of Light on Facebook to join in on our contest - we're giving away a Luminous Sea photo book!

Swim along with professional underwater photographer and marine life advocate Richard Salas as he chronicles the awe-inspiring beauty of the Pacific Northwest waters in Luminous Sea, the final installment of the Sea of Light photo book trilogy. Salas captures the marine life found off the western coast of Canada and Alaska in stunning, high-resolution images and brings them directly to the reader. Flipping through the pages of Luminous Sea, readers will feel as if they are diving alongside Salas as he explores the 43-degree water of the Pacific Ocean that few have previously explored.


What is Luminous Sea?

Luminous Sea is a collection of high-resolution, exquisitely-shot photographs that offer readers an in-depth experience of a world that lies just below the surface of the Northern Pacific Ocean. Featuring photographs from Washington to the islands of Alaska, Luminous Sea provides an escape into the chilly depths of the unknown. A world of vibrant colors and textures, the oceans of the Pacific Northwest are inhabited by an entertaining population of ocean-going characters, each with their own unique personalities. Luminous Sea uncovers a world that has rarely been viewed by the human eye and brings it right into your living room.


Donation to The Ocean Foundation

50% of the profits from Luminous Sea will be donated to The Ocean Foundation. The Ocean Foundation aims to support, strengthen and promote organizations that are dedicated to conserving ocean environments around the world. In donating Luminous Sea’s profits to The Ocean Foundation, we hope to preserve the beauty of our oceans for future generations to enjoy.


The Man Behind The Camera

Richard Salas is a professional photographer, an avid diver and lover of all marine life. Salas established his photography studio, A.S.K. Studio, 35 years ago. Primarily dealing in commercial and advertorial photography throughout a majority of his career, Salas decided in 2004 to combine his two passions--photography and diving. Salas has spent the last decade literally immersing himself in his work by diving into the underwater habitats found in his books to capture awe-inspiring images for those who wouldn’t see them otherwise.

After spending countless hours filming underwater, Salas has developed a kinship with these animals. That’s why he’s decided to donate 50% of all of Luminous Sea’s profits to the Ocean Foundation.


What is the Sea of Light trilogy?

Luminous Sea is the third and northernmost installment in the Sea of Light trilogy, a series of three books featuring awe-inspiring photographs of deep-sea habitats along the western coast of North America and Canada.  The first book in the series was Sea of Light (2009), which showcases the underwater habitats of California’s Channel Islands. After seeing demand far outweigh supply for Sea of Light, Salas released the second installation in the trilogy, Blue Visions, in 2012. Blue Visions presents readers with captivating images of the varied, and often threatened, marine life that inhabits the Islands of Mexico down to the Equator including Galapagos and Cocos Islands. Blue Visions was released in the iBookstore in the spring of 2014.


How Was Luminous Sea Shot?

For the last seven years, Richard has braved the unpredictable currents of the chilly Northern Pacific ocean to bring us a memorable collection of high-quality seascape photographs. Using an open heart, Salas is able to approach an underwater creature in its natural habitat and capture its personality in a beautiful, candid photograph.

Richard uses a Nikon 300s with a Tokina 10-17mm for wide angle shots and a 60mm and 105mm for macro with 2 Inon 240 strobes attached to a Subal housing. He dives from charter boats, including Truth Aquatics boats in Santa Barbara: the Nautilus Explorer, the old Don Jose down in Mexico and the Swell in Alaska, along with other divers and leads underwater photography workshops at Gods Pocket out of Port Hardy, British Columbia.


What Can I Expect to See in Luminous Sea?

Luminous Sea presents the unique marine life found along the coastal islands from Washington to Alaska. Readers will get up-close and personal with wildly playful 700 pound Steller Sea Lions and a 9 foot Giant Pacific Octopus. They’ll see intimate shots of the cutest fish on the planet, Spiny Lumpsuckers and colorful nudibranchs of all sizes and shapes.

Readers will see these beautiful animals that call the Pacific Northwest home, including:

  • Wolf Eels

  • Red Irish Lord

  • Spotted Ratfish

  • Decorated Warbonnets

  • Hooded Nudibranchs

  • Stubby Squid

  • Sockeye Salmon

  • Anemones like jewels spread out on the sea bottom



What’s A.S.K. Studio?

Founded by underwater photographer Richard Salas, A.S.K. Studio is the Santa Barbara-based, full-service photography studio that produces the Sea of Light trilogy. In addition to producing spectacular underwater photographs, A.S.K. Studio also works in conjunction with many major clothing and jewelry retailers to create professional product images for web, catalog and advertising.


Timeline

  • Blue Visions - ready to ship now

  • Sea of Light - will ship Dec 2014

  • Luminous Sea - will ship April 2015

I took my first trip up to Vancouver Island, Canada in 2004 on the Nautilus Explorer and was stunned at the beauty and prolific life that exists in such cold water. Over the last 10 years, I’ve been up there 9 times and can’t seem to stay away.

I wanted to show folks that even though the water is a chilly 43 degrees on average, it doesn’t mean there’s no life there. Quite the contrary, the nutrient rich sea has more life per square inch than its warmer counterparts in the tropics. Life explodes all around you diving up there and the effort it takes to dive there is well worth it.

When I dive up there, I have to put on thermal underwear, then a dry suit to keep the underwear from getting wet.  It’s more cumbersome than just throwing on a wet suit or tee shirt and shorts, but I personally think it’s more interesting up there than in the warmer waters.

“Luminous Sea” will show the colder side of things -- animals that are beautiful, cute and have lots of personality. You also will not believe the color up there -- greens, golds, yellows and blues.

Yes, you will come away with a much deeper understanding and appreciation of the great northwest.


Dimensions

  • 12" x 12"

  • 156 pages

  • Full color

  • Museum quality

  • 80lb cover stock

  • First edition: 1000 signed copies


Why Indiegogo?

The decision to host Luminous Sea on Indiegogo ultimately came down to what we hoped to achieve with the book. We produced our first two books, Sea of Light and Blue Visions, ourselves and, as such, were only able to produce a limited number of books. Being that the donation to The Ocean Foundation is directly affected by the number of copies of Luminous Sea sold, the hope is to produce as many copies of the book as possible.

That’s where you come in.

Helping us reach our funding goal will enable us to offset a portion of the production costs and, in turn, print more copies of Luminous Sea. By helping us with our campaign, you’re helping The Ocean Foundation in their continued aim to preserve the natural marine habitats of the world so that future generations can enjoy them as we have.


Perks

  • $5 - The Sockeye Salmon

    See your name added to the credits on the www.richardsalas.com website for being part of the little fishies who donated to Luminous Sea and contributed to the health of the ocean!

    Estimated delivery: August 2014


  • $10 - Goliath Grouper

    Receive a postcard with a special image not found in any of the books to thank you for supporting Luminous Sea and the ocean’s health!

    *International backers - please add $2.00 for shipping.

    Estimated delivery: August 2014


  • $15 - The Green Sea Turtle

    This perk will send you a thank you postcard as well as a high quality E-Book version of Blue Visions.

    *International backers - please add $2.00 for shipping.

    Estimated delivery: August 2014



  • $30 - The Scalloped Hammerhead

    You’ll be swimming through the music from this 3-minute Aumakua DVD of the images from Blue Visions plus a high quality E-book version of Blue Visions. 

    *International backers - please add $4.00 for shipping.

    Estimated delivery: April 2015



  • $50 - Stellar Sea Lion

    Receive a signed 8.5 x 11 inch Sea Lion print from Sea of Light, Blue Visions or Luminous Sea - your choice!

    *International backers - please add $40.00 for shipping.

    Estimated delivery: September 2014

  • $60 - Wolf Eel

    Don’t miss your chance to receive these one-time, limited-edition 11 x 14 inch prints – includes one from each of the books in the Underwater Photography Trilogy, signed and embossed with my personal stamp! These photos are as cute as the underwater animal this perk is named after.

    *International backers - please add $40.00 for shipping.

    Estimated delivery: September 2014


  • $90 - The Decorated Warbonnet

    Choose either the Sea of Light, Blue Visions or Luminous Sea photo book to add to your collection, and have your name printed inside the front cover of Luminous Sea. Books will be $100 after the Indiegogo campaign.

    *International backers - please add $50.00 for shipping.

    Estimated delivery: April 2015


  • $180 - Giant Manta Ray

    Your choice of two photobooks from the Underwater Photography Trilogy and an 8.5 X 11 print from each one you choose.

    *International backers - please add $70.00 for shipping.

    Estimated delivery: April 2015


  • $270 - The Giant Pacific Octopus

    Receive the complete Underwater Photography Trilogy collection in an Indiegogo exclusive slip case and an 8.5 X 11 inch print from each book!

    *International backers - please add $90.00 for shipping.

    Estimated delivery: April 2015


  • $1,000 - The Whale Shark

    Receive 12 archival 11 x 14 inch prints (4 exclusive images from each book) and the complete Underwater Photography Trilogy signed and embossed by photographer Richard Salas!

    *International backers - please add $90.00 for shipping.

    Estimated delivery: April 2015


  • $3,000 - Truth Aquatics Trip

    Join Richard Salas on a dive trip out in the Channel Islands plus a personal photo workshop (Airfare not included - food/ lodging/tank/weight on the boat Included)!


  • $5,000 - God’s Pocket Resort

    5 Days - One-on-one photo workshop with photographer Richard Salas at Gods Pocket, BC, Canada (Airfare not included - lodging/food/tank/weights are included for diving)!

story:
“The bicycle is a curious vehicle. Its passenger is its engine.” ~John Howard

We are a group of eight friends that simply enjoy riding our bikes. We ride to various destinations but we are not athletes :-) It just so happened that we recently discovered the beauty of bike travelling. We call ourselves "Molis fygame" which means "Just left" in Greek. That’s because we didn’t think much about it… we just left! Our first trip was from Athens to Salonika. None of us thought we could ride that far. We rode 630 km in 7 days and we were super happy we made it!

There's an old Greek saying: ''Eating makes your appetite grow bigger''. And that's why our previous ride from Athens to Salonika did not make us feel complete or tired; on the contrary, it grew new ideas in our heads, created new paths for us to follow…

Thus, we came up with a new goal; to ride again, but this time a bit further. We'll try to reach Amsterdam (1800 klms from Athens) in the Netherlands, famous for its bicycle culture. Our date of departure is the 20th of July and we hope to be in Amsterdam around the 10th of August. In order to achieve this, we have to cross five countries (Greece, Italy, Switzerland, France and Germany). We’ll leave sunbaked Athens, reach the port of Patras, sail off to Ancona, cross northern Italy, ride up and down the Alps through the Schwarzwald (Black Forrest), follow the river Rhine and hopefully reach our destination.

but a true european trip, requires true european euro…

Yet, in order to take this trip, we’ll need some financial and spiritual help! This long bicycle journey will require equipment (tires, bags), tents (we'll be sleeping on camp sites or out in the wild), clothing, nutrition (cereal bars, electrolytes, gallons of water), airplane tickets (to fly back from Amsterdam), a smartphone (one that doesn’t crash every day), data roaming units, a tablet (to update our blog and deliver to you fresh news every day), and much more!

That's why we open ourselves to you. If you have any interest in our effort and you'd like to help us, you can:

  • Support us thought our crowdfunding campain to gather 5000 euro. We would do the same for you!

  • Accommodate us! (this is more or less our route)

  • Sponsor us 

  • Spread the news! Like our facebook page, follow us on twitter, read about us on our word press blog! 

Of course you are welcome to contribute as much as you like, but we made it easier for you with these three perks:

5 euro. Stay connected and we'll keep you company throughout our adventures!

10 euro. Stay connected and we'll keep you even more company throughout our adventures!

30 euro. You get our team's handmade silkscreened t-shirt through  www.inkhead.gr

50 euro. You get our team's handmade silkscreened t-shirt and one more of your choice through  www.inkhead.gr

During this ride we are going to keep an honest and true road trip diary on our blog http://molisfygame.wordpress.com/. Expect breathtaking photos and staggering videos of beautiful landscapes of the continent; from the Mediterranean Sea in the south, to the north coast of Europe. We want to carry a message of happiness and optimism through Europe despite these times of crisis…

Share the love!

 

                              μόλις φύγαμε | we just left :-)

                                         molisfygame.wordpress.com

                                          facebook.com/molisfygame

                                                   twitter @molisfygame

                                     google search: we just left :-)

story:
Who? What?: Help Garrett Russell and Sara Miller begin their cycling journey around the US beginning on the Northern Tier bicycle route as they raise money, awareness, and stand in solidarity with the peoples' of Ecuador who have courageously defended their culture, environment, livelihoods and home for the past 18 years against the corporate oil giant, Chevron/Texaco.

How we are connected; our story:  In 2007, Garrett traveled to Ecuador on a travel course with Pacific University to tour the Amazon and the country.  In a serendipitous chain of events the story and camera changed paths as he and his group became entwined in the indigenous Ecuadorian plaintiff’s fight for elemental human rights.  The journey left a lasting impact and formed the narrative for the documentary “Sipping Black Water” which can be viewed at the link below.  Since then, Garrett with partner Sara, have lived deeply connected with the outcomes, story and people of the region.  May the men, women and children of the poisoned rainforest communities who have inspired us to take action, speak clearly to you and allow us all to rise in solidarity as family directly connected by the earth under our feet.

  • “Sipping Black Water” can be seen in 3 parts for free at: http://vimeo.com/21463752

  • To follow our journey check out our blogs at:

Sara's Blog

http://www.crazyguyonabike.com/cyclingsaraswati

 

Garrett's Blog

http://www.crazyguyonabike.com/garonthego

 

     

 Funding useage: Funds raised here will go directly to food, water and shelter to support us on our journey.  We will be living a frugal lifestyle on the road as mobile nomads without any support vehicles.  We will live in a tent for the duration of this journey eating primarily simple meals cooked on our camp stove.  Donated funds will allow us to survive and continue the journey for the purpose of sharing the plaintiffs’ story and in connecting with the peoples, lands and cultures that we encounter throughout this vast and beautiful country.  Thank you in advance for your generous sharing of resources to make this dream come true.  Peace be the journey.

Do your part: We also encourage any and all peoples in all places in the U.S. and abroad to participate or put on an event in your community to stand in solidarity with both our 15,000 mile trek and the inspiring individuals and communities in the Ecuadorian Amazon who are fighting for clean water, basic healthcare, justice, dignity and to be heard.  Ride your bike 10 miles across town, start a walk-a-thon or jump rope everyday while supporting in mind and spirit our family in the damaged rainforest.  Help support these communities with clean water and adequate services while creating a better intent for the people and path of the U.S. We are all truly connected in our daily actions with the source extraction of our fuels, the companies we choose to support financially and the affects of this nation upon cultures and places throughout this planet we all call home.  May this be our small piece of the greater action sweeping our generation and culture to bring positive change and a sustainable future for the next kin of this earth. Through word we create action, and through action we manifest change; spread the word and be the change.   

  •  Learn More about the plight of the Amazonian plaintiffs at: http://chevrontoxico.com/ and at http://amazonwatch.org

  •  Donate in solidarity with the Ecuadorian Indigenous at: http://www.firstgiving.com/fundraiser/cycleUS/c...
story_txt:
Who? What?: Help Garrett Russell and Sara Miller begin their cycling journey around the US beginning on the Northern Tier bicycle route as they raise money, awareness, and stand in solidarity with the peoples' of Ecuador who have courageously defended their culture, environment, livelihoods and home for the past 18 years against the corporate oil giant, Chevron/Texaco.
How we are connected; our story:  In 2007, Garrett traveled to Ecuador on a travel course with Pacific University to tour the Amazon and the country.  In a serendipitous chain of events the story and camera changed paths as he and his group became entwined in the indigenous Ecuadorian plaintiff’s fight for elemental human rights.  The journey left a lasting impact and formed the narrative for the documentary “Sipping Black Water” which can be viewed at the link below.  Since then, Garrett with partner Sara, have lived deeply connected with the outcomes, story and people of the region.  May the men, women and children of the poisoned rainforest communities who have inspired us to take action, speak clearly to you and allow us all to rise in solidarity as family directly connected by the earth under our feet.



“Sipping Black Water” can be seen in 3 parts for free at: http://vimeo.com/21463752



To follow our journey check out our blogs at:

Sara's Blog
http://www.crazyguyonabike.com/cyclingsaraswati
 
Garrett's Blog
http://www.crazyguyonabike.com/garonthego

story:
Fire — The original TV, the conversation starter, warmth on frigid nights, and where the tastiest meals are cooked. The place where we get together to bring out our inner kid. Where we laugh and sing, and where deep bonds are forged.  Yet, campfires leave behind a footprint that can be hard to remove.

With this in mind, Fire Safe was born.

Our patent-pending hinged collapsible design allows for a large fuel capacity and mighty fire while maintaining a packdown size slimmer than 1” and weighing less than 2.2lbs. This enables you to go on any kind of adventure (big or small) while minimizing the space it takes up in your bag.

 

We constructed Fire Safe entirely from 304 Stainless Steel. This material was selected precisely for its durability, corrosion resistance and long life while promoting a beautiful patina that develops over time, just like with our Grill M1 Edition.  

 

Fire Safe was designed and engineered specifically to maximize efficiencies while minimizing its consumption. 

 

  • Airflow direction has been carefully engineered to create an efficient and clean burn of charcoal or wood in strong-to-light wind conditions

 

  • Wind shielding provided by the frame ensures you light and keep your fires hassle-free 

 

  • It's segmented, corrugated design allows you to add charcoal to only the areas that you wish to heat, allowing you to use just enough fuel to cook your meal, rather than wasting monumental amounts of charcoal

 

  • Our insert was designed to require less so you can do more. In fact, Fire Safe requires 26% less fuel per unit of surface area than its closest "competitor"

 

 

  • After use, the same component that allowed for efficient airflow acts as a scoop for the ashes creating the first disposal-conscious fire containment base. We specifically designed this with a minimal trace mentality.

 

Every design decision we make is deliberate and thoughtful. That’s why we ensured Fire Safe could work beautifully with its partner-in-crime, our Grill M1 Edition. These two harmonize together to create an optimal cooking and heating environment.

Fire Safe’s segmented fuel containment and our predetermined Grill M1 Edition heights enables your fuel to be used in a highly efficient way for cooking. Furthermore, it allows for better control of heat zones for different foods. 

 

Fire Safe’s design ensures a quick and easy pack-down while our included compact case seals it away for convenient transportation. This function also allows your Fire Safe to stow away cleanly, ensuring your other gear doesn’t become dirty.

 

Fire Safe is stored in a case that follows the same design principles. The case features modular pockets for accessories, like our Fire Set or Grill Surface, as well as storage for kindling.

 

Fire Safe’s material finishes have been detailed to be nonporous, making them easy to clean without additional harmful coatings. This uncoated single material assembly ensures that full recycling is as easy as possible, requiring no disassembly. 

The case is constructed from a heavy weight, tough weave, recycled polyester (PET/RPET), backed with a PET inner layer, ensuring yet again the fewest material types are used for both sustainability and a uniform design language. 

 

Our design approach was born through hearing your needs and was incorporated at every stage of the process. 

We considered and tested a multitude of factors, environments and variables. We spent hours in our studio and in the field (literally) to shape a sustainable, visually clean, and finely detailed outcome. 

And finally, after all this time, we’ll have a chance to clean up and wash our endless supply of dirty tea and coffee mugs that littered our studio.

 

Wolf and Grizzly didn’t start with a product, or even with a product idea. It started with a frustration of mine that wasn’t specific to one object: everything I owned could be grouped into two categories: products that looked great, but were weak— belonging in “the city”—and gear that was functional, clunky and difficult to use, fit for the outdoors.

Those outdoor goods were stowed away in my basement, reserved for trips and meticulously planned adventures. Since they couldn’t be used on a day-to-day basis, what would be the point in keeping them anywhere else?

But I was convinced that this dichotomy was senseless. And I held a firm belief that if outdoor tools could be usable, durable and well-designed, they would help us to adventure on a whim— without all the planning, searching and packing. These tools would enable people to experience and live an outdoor lifestyle all year round, from backyard to backcountry.

Inspired by this, I left my career as an engineer to found Wolf and Grizzly. It became my outlet to create a set of goods that were built to cater to the needs of adventurers in every context.

With the initial care and support of an incredible set of family and friends, as well as colleagues who grew to friends, Wolf and Grizzly launched the Grill M1 on Kickstarter in 2017. At over 220% funded, the product was met with exceptional reception from many media outlets. More importantly though, we received hundreds of customer messages expressing their deep appreciation of the product and the level of care that’s evidenced by every interaction we carry out.

From there, friends and family manned tradeshow booths, enabling us to act like grownups while still being toddlers. Shortly after, WG moved from the spare bedroom to two desks at a local accelerator. Now, we're a team huddled around a group of desks in an old tannery and working over Zoom in remote offices. Tiny as we may be, we remain a force together that we believe can change the world.

You, on Indiegogo, enabled this journey and so we're back again. Not just to raise funds for a product, but to work with you to continue to build this vision.  

Roy Chapman Andrews once wrote, "always there has been an adventure just around the corner— and the world is still full of corners." Wolf and Grizzly exists to enable this adventure from backyard to backcountry. We hope you'll join us.

Warm regards,

story:
Save Lindsey Wolfe From The Ren Faire Trip Of Doom!

Lindsey Wolfe and her fiance, Frank, came to the Black Rock Ren Faire in Augusta, MI to be a vendor and make some money. What they ended up with was a dead car, a camper with four flat tires, and a U-Haul mishap that lost them their business computer. Now they're trapped in Michigan with no way to recoup their losses and no idea how they're going to get home.

This is where you come in:

Lindsey has been a long-time reader of mine, who has turned into a cherished internet friend. I just want to help her get her vehicles running so she can get back home!

Here is what I'm going to do:

  • If you donate a hundred bucks ($100.00), I'll name a character after you in one of my Abigail Barnette books. Just, you know, be prepared for that character to be a Victorian harlot or a gay baseball player. You know what I write. I'll use just your first name, if you prefer.
  • If you donate fifty bucks ($50.00), you'll be included in a book dedication.
  • If you donate anything under that, I'll put your name on the big old list of awesome people that helped Lindsey, which will go on my blog at the end of the fundraising project.
  • Author Bronwyn Green will send 4 ebooks from her backlist to everyone who donates $25 or more!
  •  

Other perks will likely be added later, I'm still trying to wrangle some.

Even if we don't reach the goal I set for this thing, all the money that does get raised will go to Lindsey. Every little bit helps!

I just want to help Lindsey and her partner get home! If we make the goal of $1000, I will continue recapping the 50 Shades of Grey books on my blog!

 

Plus, everyone who donates at any level will be entered in a drawing to win a necklace from http://www.etsy.com/shop/NerdyNecklaces !

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're in the Augusta, MI area and you can work on cars or you have some tires, contact me at jenny@jenniferarmintrout.com and let's get this thing worked out!
